Reviews.Title: “Surprising Property, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Julie87508
Reviews.Content: We were put up at the Erwin during a recent business trip to LA. While not a hotel I would likely have chosen myself, we were pleasantly surprised and I have to say I would seriously consider staying here again if in the area. First the rooms--think a sort of dated "Jetsons" look and you won't be far off. Fun, funky furniture, bright colors. We had a 1 BR suite and it was spacious, clean and just as described. The bed was VERY comfortable, the linens soft and cushy, kitchenette area very nice and a well-stocked mini bar. The sofa bed mattress was a little tired but "sleepable" according to our daughter, who stayed with us. Next...location. This is the good news/bad news. The Erwin is 1/2 block from the ocean, but also in proximity to the Boardwalk and therefore LOTS of street noise/parties at night. We didn't sleep much the first night. Staff/Service: Absolutely outstanding staff--friendly, courteous, professional. Restaurant: We had breakfast both mornings in the restaurant, BarLo, and the food was excellent. We didn't have a chance to eat dinner there, but checked out the menu--very innovative, lots of locally sourced produce, very nice wine selection. It rained the night we had time to enjoy the rooftop lounge, but the view looks to be killer, so maybe next time. Overall: Really surprisingly great property in proximity to the hot, happenin' Abbott Kinney St. in Venice. Close to the water, spacious rooms (and they are updating the entire property), comfortable bed. Our biggest issue was noise--so ask to be in a room NOT facing the back of the property, or bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Venice”
Reviews.Author: FannieM_50
Reviews.Content: Roof top bar was amazing with a beatiful view of the sunset. The bartender was very friendly and had some great recommendations of other cool places for us to visit while we were in the area. We had one rainy day while in Venice so it was great to have a suite to kick back and watch a movie in our room. The hotel gives you the option of going green and of course we did....what a great idea!! Coupons to use for dinner in the restaurant! Wonderful food (the shrimp and grits were fantastic) While eating at Barlo we checked in on "Yelp" and was able to recieve a free cocktail, which was awesome! The young lady at the front desk was very friendly and made the arrival and check out process very smooth. Will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience with Hotel Erwin”
Reviews.Author: Lance K
Reviews.Content: My wife, 10-year-old daughter, and I had a great experience staying in a suite at the Hotel Erwin. The room was great, service was excellent all-around, with special kudos to front desk person Miguel, who went out of his way to to assist us with traveling advise, recommendations, etc. The outside of the hotel was unimpressive as major renovations were being made to the exterior and it was covered with scaffolding, but the suite was delightful. You're one block from the beach. If you're looking for pure relaxation and beautiful surroundings, this is probably not where you want to stay. You're in the heart of the very lively Venice Beach neighborhood which is very active and a little scruffy, but the hotel itself was delightful. If you want to stay in Venice, this is a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic experience in Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Cleisha
Reviews.Content: Anticipating my first visit and overnighter to Venice Beach we chose this hotel for four adults sharing a two queen room. Prepare to experience an eclectic crowd outside the hotel. I highly recommend that you exit the hotel on foot only by day, it can be a questionable crowd at night considering there is a hostel nearby and many homeless surround the area. The hotel staff was friendly and the room was well kept. When we requested additional towels, a quick friendly response was offered. The restaurant is another story, I could not comment on the food as we seated ourselves and left after waiting 20 minutes and retrieving the menu independently after one was not offerred. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks ago when I had to move out of my building for some repairs. It was a busy weekend with warm weather, almost like summer. Every staff member we encountered was professional and polite. The hotel was very busy and sometimes when this is the case, especially when perhaps it wasn't planning on being so busy (again, unseasonably warm weather) service can suffer. This was not the case at all. We went to High to watch the sunset and had a nice time. We ate breakfast both mornings in barlo, good food and friendly service. The rooms are clean and modern. If you're looking for a uniquely southern california experience, this is a great hotel. It's in a location that is convenient to everything on the West Side and you can't beat the Venice people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad-What Are You Looking For?”
Reviews.Author: Jayson_Charles
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Erwin is very nice and the staff is very accomodating. The beach is right there and you can pretty much walk everywhere. I have 2 issues; 1. the thermostat in our room was in the living area, so the living room was nice and cool, but, the bedroom was hot and stuffy. And because they are a green hotel the thermostat would only go down to around 67 degrees; may just be our room. Also, $60 to leave my car parked and untouched for 2 days is a little sucky as a hotel guest. If I used the valet I could see that, but to arrive and not see my car again till checkout, ouch. If my concerns are of no concern to you, this is a great place; go for it.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen G
Reviews.Content: I recently moved to Venice from NYC. I'd stayed at Hotel Erwin 2-3 times so when I was booking a hotel for my mother and aunt I thought of it since it's 4 blocks from my new place. Our first night we went to dinner and while we were at dinner someone came into their room and stole a camera and a brand new iphone that had been charging. These things happen and it was unfortunate, but it was more upsetting how the hotel handled the situation. After thoroughly searching the room to confirm it was taken we called the front desk. The didn't have a manager on duty so we filled out the report with their restaurant manager who told us to come back in the morning to continue the process. He assured us that they would check the security cameras. My Aunt and my mom returned the next morning and finished the report. They had no information about the cameras and never followed up on that. They said their insurance would cover the phone, but couldn't confirm for how much and when the insurance company would get in contact. Refused to give us the name or number of the insurance company so there is no way for them to follow up. Couldn't assure us any time line or details. At the end of that conversation they said they would comp the 2 nights. When they checked out on the clerk didn't know about the comped rooms and raised his voice when my aunt brought of the theft. He literally yelled at her "There is no theft in our hotel!" My aunt calmly clarified and insisted. Eventually he comped the rooms like they had promised. Then he started to charge her for the entire contents of the mini-bar. Apparently, when the theft occurred they also cleaned out the mini-bar. But because we never opened the the fridge we had no idea. Very strange. Again, we had to fight with the front desk- convincing them that 2 women in their late 60s didn't consume the entire contents of the mini-bar. Needless to say this event dominated their entire weekend. I appreciate that theft can be a sensitive and difficult situation to deal with in a hotel, but we were patient and understanding at every turn. I was personally surprised to see how calmly my aunt and mom were since their room had been broken into. It was frustrating to see how the hotel dealt with calm, collected and understanding customers. I would hate to see how they handle customers who are less forgiving. I have to say now I'd never recommend the Hotel Erwin and I certainly wouldn't stay there with valuables.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect LA beach weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Josh W
Reviews.Content: For my wife's birthday I surprised her with a little weekend beach getaway. We could not have been happier with the time we had at Hotel Erwin in Venice. The rooftop bar at the hotel, "High", is amazing. I don't think there is a better place to watch a sunset in LA. The drinks hit the spot as well. After drinks, that Friday evening happened to also be "First Friday" on Abbot Kinney. Hotel Erwin is in a great location to walk to the street/food truck fair as well as everything else in the Venice Beach area. It was the perfect evening. The next morning could not have worked out better as well. Our with a delicious breakfast in Barlo was followed by a walk along the famous Venice boardwalk. The hotel is not only in the perfect location for the ideal LA beach experience, but it is extremely hip and comfortable at the same time. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Sembriaco
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erwin was one of my little splurges on my last trip in SoCal...my boyfriend and I were looking forward to a boutique eclectic style experience & Hotel Erwin did not disappoint. During our stay, the hotel was undergoing some renovations however, we were not inconvenienced what so ever & the $10 restaurant vouchers in exchange for the disturbance made up for it. The service at this hotel was exceptional; Anderson the Valet was a gem. He catered to all our needs and went way beyond the duties of his job title. We also had a chance to try their new restaurant which was slightly pricey for breakfast but the choices were so interesting & yummy we didn't really care when the bill came! Another fun feature of the hotel is the rooftop deck with the cozy couches and a perfect view of Venice Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Another trip to Venice Beach and Beautiful Hotel Erwin”
Reviews.Author: Clare M
Reviews.Content: Well, another amazing stay at Hotel Erwin last month when I needed to be in LA for work - the staff is incredible. The GM Ben is the nicest guy as well for special needs or requests. But honestly from valet to front desk to the maid-service you can't get a bad service at this place. I am headed back down at the end of this month and this time bringing people to entertain there. With great food, the rooftop deck, the beach you can be there for work, pleasure, a romantic weekend - it is all worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Classy gem in Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Martamom
Reviews.Content: A very classy hotel just steps from the freak show of the Venice Beach strip. We were upgraded to a suite which was fantastically huge, modern, and comfortable. The rooftop bar is fabulous and affords great views. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was delicious. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for rooftop events”
Reviews.Author: Jenn_M3112
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous happy hour work event at Hotel Erwinâ€™s High. We had an amazing view of all Venice, and great drinks. With the excellent help of the sales team, and Mina specifically, the event was a huge success.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fab rooftop bar on Venice Beach.”
Reviews.Author: SueH9
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great restaurant and rooftop bar which attracts visitors from afar. You can see for miles and great for sunsets. Only thing for us which was strange was the room decor but this did not detract from our stay and maybe fits the theme of Venice Beach as it is a weird experience overall. We had a great stay and reception staff were great and very helpful if you needed anything. Very interesting visit and everyone should have a couple of nights here just to people watch. Beachside restaurants great and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning rooftop lounge”
Reviews.Author: f00dmama
Reviews.Content: Quite a funky hotel to stay in,we were upgraded to a suite which has a kitchen in it which gave extra space.The highlight was the rooftop lounge which has 360 views over Los Angeles a brilliant spot to sit and watch the amazing Californian sunsets from while drinking a watermelon margarita.The hotel staff were so helpful especially Eugene at the desk and Chip .I wish that there had been more areas to sit inside the hotel,the bar/restaurant was small,and I was not very keen on the area,but a very popular hotel not maybe suitable for families with children

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel right by the beach”
Reviews.Author: Baydr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first three nights of our two week road trip in August 2011. The hotel is located right on Venice Beach, which although I'm a fan of, it might be considered a little rough around the edges for some. Regardless you can't argue with the location, as it's right next to the beach and promenade. You are able to get beach towels for free from reception. It's worth exploring the area away from the beach such as the shops on Abbot Kinney or the Venice canals which shows there is a lot more to the area then you would first imagine. The hotel itself is modern and our room was much larger than I expected with views over the ocean as well as inland. There's free wifi and HD content on the TV's which is nice. Parking's not cheap at the hotel but it is pretty easy to park in the area if you're willing to walk for a few minutes. Just be mindful of the parking restrictions which fall on different days based on when they're cleaning the street. There's a trendy rooftop hotel bar which was really nice with some great views, as you'd imagine. The only downside is that it seemed to be a destination in itself with complete with an achingly hip crowd and door control. At times we did feel like outsiders in our own hotel. All in all, if you're planning to stay in Venice then this is definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super cool spot at Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: frieda g
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot! So I had to share this gem in Venice Beach. Hotel Erwin has one of the sweetest roof bars, blankets are provided if there's a chill and the drinks are classically made, some with an updated twist. My room was cozy with a very comfortable bed, a roomy bathroom was smartly designed with a fantastic sink and superb showerhead. My room overlooked the beach where I could sit outside and drink my morning coffee, or dine at a little table for two set in the room. Attention to detail was certainly on the minds of those that revitalized this historic hotel. Loved all the Larry Bell watercolours scattered throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AliMD22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Erwin in Venice Beach. They are in a prime location for exploring Venice Beach. Nice, clean, and spacious rooms. Valet parking was quick and convenient. We had a kitchenette, which was awesome. The bed was comfortable. The location of our room was a little noisy with street traffic. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Peachy79
Reviews.Content: I was a bit stressed about finding a clean and decent hotel in Venice Beach. I booked the Hotel Erwin based on TripAdvisor reviews. What a great experience. Great location close to the beach and Abbot Kinney for chic shops and restaurants. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Although I didn't eat in the restaurant, the room service was delicious and very fresh. Can't wait to go back! Rooms were great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing”
Reviews.Author: GinnyBeeking
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time to find a nice affordable hotel around Venice Beach/Santa Monica. But, look no further, this hotel is it! The hotel is in the middle of Venice Beach with the hippy/rock thing going on. A loved the experience! The hotel is right next to the beach and the rooms are very modern, clean and provide a nice view (recommended). Downside, one night there was VERY loud music coming from the bar on the roof. Might be worth to ask when they have things planned so you can work around it. I couldn't sleep because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SmarteCookie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 2 young children, and the room as clean, spacious enough, and the location was fantastic - a few feet from the beach AND a great playground! There are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance. Staff was helpful, though since it is the beach there is a laid-back vibe. Nice views from rooftop bar. We booked a suite so we would have a kitchenette plus a little more room for the kids, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ejohanson007
Reviews.Content: My wife n I were on the westside of LA n need a place to stay so we decided to give Hotel Erwin a call n see if they could accomodate us. They did n I have to say that our experience, for the 2nd time, did not disappoint. We got a great room with an amazing of of the ocean, santa monica pier, as well as santa monica. The service was excellent, my wife had accidently burned her hand earlier in the day n it began hurting her in the middle of the night n all I had to do was call the front desk n they sent up some burn/first aid spray to alleviate the pain. Would definitely recommend this hotel to all who are looking for a fun.cool,hip, centrally located hotel on the westside.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sexy and I know it.”
Reviews.Author: LisaanDevin
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect boutique hotel experience. Me and my boyfriend planned a trip to Venice and since one of our favorite musical groups LMFAO made a video on the boardwalk I went so far as to buy him the speedos in the video. Which made this hotel the hottest was the awesome lime green cheetah print robes that are offered in the rooms. That just happen to match the speedo. Woot woot. Anyway the staff was amazing they put us on the newly renovated sixth floor. With an awesome ocean view. Amazing. Plus the hotel downstairs with the cool name of "Hash" made the most amazing. And I repeat amazing egg white frittata and homemade sour dough bread. It was the bees knees. The coffee was fab and the personality was pique. I would def stay again no doubt. I work out!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Venice Beach, LA”
Reviews.Author: terrytTerry
Reviews.Content: If you plan to stay in Venice Beach this is the place to get a room. And make sure you pay teh extra for a sea view too.. It's well worth the extra money. If you're not staying here then pay a visit at sunset for a drink on the roof terrace.. The sunset is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Amick1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice now, and can't say enough good things about it. We love the location at Venice Beach because for us it is close to our daughters who live nearby, plus it is very close to the Venice boardwalk, which we love to walk on - even if it is a little funky...The beach there is beautiful. The rooms are very clean, with a modern feel that we like. We have a view of both the ocean and the city, with a small balcony to enjoy them from. They are roomy, have great beds and the rooms we have stayed in have nice sized bathrooms too. There is plenty of closet space and also a nice sized dresser which was important because we stayed there for a week. There is also a coffee maker in the room. The staff at the front desk are very helpful, and are eager to please. So nice. Also, this last time when the hairdryer broke, they brought another one up right away. We also love the restaurant which is just off the hotel lobby. We have only had breakfast there, but they have a great selection of items to choose from, and again are very attentive. Overall, we love this place and wouldn't hesitate to go back again. It's so nice to be able to open up the sliding glass door to hear and feel the ocean breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location - great botique”
Reviews.Author: Shlomo K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Erwin twice now - the location is simply amazing. The staff is great and very friendly and the rooms are just right. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Erwin- The Hidden Treasure of Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erwin is the hidden treasure of California. Their staff and hotel is fresh and stylish. The room we stayed at was clean and very home like. We had a view of the Pacific Ocean that was only 500 yards away. It is right in the heart of Venice Beach and is on the pulse of the culture . It's roof top bar is fun for socializing and can be romantic as you watch a California sunset on the ocean horizon. We will definitely be reserving a room there for our next visit this summer.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in LA by the ocean”
Reviews.Author: parvatee
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Erwin 3 times during the last 2 years, at different time of the year. It's a lovely and friendly place, in the heart of Venice beach, with comfortable, moder and clean bedrooms, great and unique view and a wonderful terrass on the roof to enjoy the view on Venice or the sunset on Santa Monica with a glass of champagne or a mojito. I love it, great vibe, clean, nice people, very helpful front desk, amazing place to stay

Reviews.Title: “cool place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Katya_80_11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel couple of times. Good service, nice location, clean rooms. Plenty of good restaurants around. I am sure that next time I will stay definitely at Erwin. And special thanks to the managers Miguel, Harim and Zhenya)) Katya

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but, needs improvement in service”
Reviews.Author: BullCityTraveler57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Erwin four times over the past three years (most recently December 11). The location is great and the overall vibe of the property is cool, hip, and funky. It seems that the management believes the great location and the cool vibe is all it needs to be successful. There doesn't appear to be a guest service focus at all. The service at the front desk is painfully slow and unattentiive. As others have said, the rooms are in need of maintenance and updating. Nothing serious, they are just tired. In spite of the poor guest service and the need for room maintenance, the Hotel Erwin is a good choice if you want to stay in Venice. Just don't expect four star service and accomandations.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: vettechick
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Erwin. It is a great location. The staff is amazing, courteous, professional - and most importantly smiling! Miguel at the front desk is a huge asset to the property.

Reviews.Title: “The Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: EMU0425
Reviews.Content: The restaurant is new remodeled and the food is amazing. The atmosphere is stylish and the service was great. I'm a salmon lover and I can't say enough about how flavorful it was. My friends had the burgers and they love it. If your in the Venice area or staying at this hotel you have to check out the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great, Dated Rooms, Chic Feeling”
Reviews.Author: MichaelScottsdale
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Joie de Vivre properties and typically find them to be chic with comfortable beds and moderately priced. Hotel Erwin in Venice has a nice location and a nice rooftop deck with great views of Venice Beach. The hallways and feeling of the hotel are modern and swanky, but the rooms definitely leave something to be desired. The decor in the rooms is tired with old worn furniture. Bathrooms are nice, but overall there are better options for similarly priced hotels. If you're just looking for somewhere to lay your head this may be a good option, but it's not a great hotel for a destination vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is Cool”
Reviews.Author: Deborah4967
Reviews.Content: Great location one/half block frorm Oceanfront Walkway, 15 minutes from LAX airport. Cool, hip, modern design. Friendly staff. Large thick towels, smooth crisp bedsheets, lots of pillows. Rooftop bar with view of Venice and the ocean. Good restaurant Barlo off the lobby for meals all day and bar in the evening. Lots of restaurants and shopping on the Walkway and Main Street outside the hotel, and Abbott Kinney Blvd, a few minutes awawy. It is possible to walk north to Santa Monica pier, restaurants, bars and shopping. Very clean. Take advantage of the valaet parking, because street parking is sparse and short-term, and the nearby lots are set up for beach visitors, and have no in and out.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Nicole H
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a comfotable bed and a fun rooftop bar but it was dirty and we had to pay for internet and it was also quite expensive. The location was pretty good, but overall i wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: SunnySurreyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 5 nights at the Erwin, excellent friendly hotel and room was spot on in all respects. Room had a lovely balcony with great sunsets each evening and views of the mountains to the north and east. Would recommend to anyone who wants to spend time exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay perfect!”
Reviews.Author: B A
Reviews.Content: My wife booked several nights for my birthday during a visit from Boston. I enjoy unique hotels and they certainly delivered. The staff were great, from reservations, to valet to front desk, helping us navigate our way around the nearby beach and enjoy all that Venice has to offer. The suite was fantastic, from the extra room we needed after traveling all day in the car to the decorative touches that made this birthday distinct. The art throughout and the rooftop bar was so much fun! We definitely would recommend others to travel and stay!

Reviews.Title: “Funky but flawed”
Reviews.Author: Dorset4Ever
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Erwin is a great place to stay. It is just a little let down by it's surroundings. I do admit our visit was 'out of season' April, but side streets, and general area, were a little run down. We didn't feel comfortable venturing out at night, but the Erwin has a great alternative - the roof top bar 'High'. It is very cool, and has amazing views (especially at night) across LA. The room's were good, and we had a free upgrade for one of them (for a Facebook 'like!) to a suite, really nice to have dinning table, settee, and kitchenette, in a good size room. Our breakfast in 'Eat', was ok, but was served warm, not hot. Service at the desk was great, in addition to the response's from my 'online' questions, prior to our visit. I would recommend a stay at the Erwin (for great access to Venice Beach), they do know how to look after you.

Reviews.Title: “a hip stay!”
Reviews.Author: GZMOA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place in November for just one night. The hotel is very trendy and in the heart of Venice beach, near the beach, close to abbot kinney blv. as well. The front desk staff is very very polite and helpfull. the rooms are clean and very big. As a tip, if you have a car try the parking area opposite the hotel since it is much cheaper as compraed to the hotel's parking. Please keep in mind that Venice ibeach is very different and bohemian as compared to the popular santa monica area.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Jules081
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Erwin after a long drive from Las Vegas and were met by really friendly valet and reception staff. We had booked a city view room but were given a partial ocean view room which had a fantastic lounge, kitchen area, bedroom and bathroom, it couldnâ€™t have been better. We went to the rooftop bar most evenings to watch the sunset, fantastic atmosphere and great choice of drinks. If we went early evening they tried to get us seats before people arrived for their reservations. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and although the portions were a little small the food couldnâ€™t be faulted. The hotel is perfectly situated for getting around. We loved Venice beach, itâ€™s so interesting with loads to see. We actually missed all the goings on when we got to Santa Monica! It only took about half an hour to walk to Santa Monica and itâ€™s such a nice walk along the seafront. We also walked to the Marina and around the Canals which is worth doing. There are plenty of places to eat near the hotel, itâ€™s only a short walk to Abbot Kinney Boulevard which had lots of places to choose from, the walk there is through some fairly unlit side roads but we felt perfectly safe. We also went to Larryâ€™s Bar (right by the hotel) and James Beach (about a 5 minute walk away up Pacific Avenue), both of which had fantastic food. Apparently every 3rd Thursday there is an arts festival around Venice Beach and the hotel gets involved. We arrived back to arts and crafts stands, bars and a DJ in the driveway of the hotel, and across the road there were more stalls. It was such an amazing atmosphere and great to see the hotel getting involved in the local community. Valet parking was really quick, we didnâ€™t have to wait longer than a couple of minutes. The hotel is in great location to get to the freeways quickly, we found it easy to get to the Warner Brother Studio, Griffith Observatory, Hollywood, Rodeo Drive and Downtown, and we also drove down to San Diego for the day which only took 2 hours (make use of the car pool lanes if you can, makes life much easier!). The hotel is also only a 10 min drive to the airport along one main road (Lincoln Boulevard). Having read reviews I wasnâ€™t sure whether Iâ€™d like Venice Beach but I absolutely loved it, and Hotel Erwin was the perfect hotel to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “A good place on Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Amazinggrace507
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Erwin. I appreciate the location and the security in the hotel. It is at the end of the Venice strip so a quiet location at night. I love the rooftop bar/restaurant to watch the sunsets over the ocean. Rooms are OK and bathroom has little privacy with a sliding glass door, but overall a good value for Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: juliaburns
Reviews.Content: Firstly - I love venice beach - during a recent trip to LA we stayed in Marina del rey at a different hotel, but on our return to LA for our return flights we decided to splash out on the hotel erwin. The hotel is expensive - I wouldnt usually pay out so much for a hotel, but we did enjoy our stay. The check in was fine, we upgraded to a 6th floor room for an extra $25 per night, which didnt seem like much, but once you factor in city tax, tourist tax etc etc etc etc our bill was nearly $700 for 2 nights - this was a lot more than we had planned on spending so be careful as the prices quoted on the websites (we booked with booking.com) doesnt include all the extra costs!! The room was beautiful - newly decorated, lovely large glass balcony which had a view of venice beach and the promenade.. we would have preferred day time sun but we got the sunset instead which was beautiful. Now onto the roof top bar - well, the first night we went up there and it was pretty busy, but we couldnt get a table to sit down as they were all reserved but half empty. we only stayed for 1 drink and left. As we were leaving I asked the maitre if i could book a table for the following day/evening. she said that we could and that she would make a reservation in the afteroon and then again in the evening.. so the following afternoon we arrived, to be told that the reservation hadnt been made.. and that she had only suggested it to me.. not actually booked it. so we went back up at 7pm when the evening reservation started.. we were given the table we requested which was private in the far corner of the bar.. however she had to move people off it first. she then approached us 40 minutes later and told us that our reservation was only for 2 hours and that we had to move at 9pm. we finished our drinks and left straight away - we had a room on the floor below with the same view where drinks didnt cost $20 a go.. so.. in summary - the hotel is nice but expensive, and the bar isnt worth visiting as it is expensive and the staff are totally rubbish. good place for a splurge but certainly not worth the huge bill when you check out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, better service”
Reviews.Author: mjm19
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its location (1/2 way between Santa Monica and Marina Del Rey) and for the highly recommended rooftop bar, but it was the excellent service that will have us coming back. The hotel is situated just across from the Venice Beach park and we enjoyed a walk down the beach to Santa Monica pier (~30 min) and then an afternoon of shopping on the Santa Monica promenade. We spent the evening on the rooftop bar with a selection of the excellent appetizers and the watermelon margarita - quite tasty. The service that we received set the Erwin apart, however. Miguel, Mina and the rest of the staff were very accomodating, and even went the extra mile to ensure that we had an extra special anniversary with complimentary champagne and strawberries in our room. The service that we received at the High Bar, and BarLo only reinforced the effort that the staff makes to make everyone feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: war47
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at this hotel in the rain it did not inspire me. It is a grotty part of Venice beach and the area does not encourage people to go and mingle in the locality. The rooms were clean and we were on the 5th. floor with a side view of the beach and the room was a fair size and clean and comfortable. The views from the rooftop bar were excellent. Breakfast was not included in the cost but served in the ground floor bar and was of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: Avatarsg
Reviews.Content: you have to remember where you are and Hotel Erwin is about as good as it gets on Venice beach......... We booked a premier ocean view room believing this would be our "front row seats to the Pacific Ocean" as stated on the web site. Be warned this hotel is not on the beach, all the rooms have a partial ocean view with the exception of some 5th floor rooms but even these like all the others actually look over car lots, tattoo parlours and dumpsters. The orientation of the hotel is not as the web site would lead you to believe. Took us a while to get over the shock and clarify with reception that we were in the right room and yes this was one of their premier rooms - having viewed a room on the 4th as an alternative I can vouch that the 6th floor is premier but don't expect a lot. The premier room was basic, bathroom and bed linen clean but the other furnishings could do with a good clean. The roof top bar is the view and a great place for a drink however on both of the 2 nights we stayed private functions had the space booked so we only got to use it once. Breakfast is served in the ground floor bar and this was actually very good - good coffee, bacon and even veggie sausages. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. This is an OK hotel for youngsters who are not expecting much from the rooms (or don't plan to be in them much).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if you don't mind the grit of Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Rev777
Reviews.Content: This is a young, retro trendy hotel, as close to the beach in Venice as you can be. we had a suite (upgrade was offered for â‚¬40/night) which was pretty big, with a decent balcony directly overlooking the beach (via a car park and the tattoo huts!). If you know what you are getting into by staying in Venice beach, then you'll love it. If not, you may not. It's cool, fun and exciting, but it has a lot of weirdos and tramps hanging around the boardwalk.Whilst this makes for great people watching and is fFine during the day, it's a bit seedy at night so you wouldn't want to walk around late. However, this is not a negative of this hotel in particular if Venice is where you want to stay as everywhere else will be the same. Pros: Right on the beach. Close to the bars and restaurants of Venice. Nice rooftop bar with views over the city and beach. Service was great. Retro cool. Cons: Decor a bit tired, could do with a lick of paint in places. Breakfasts not inlcluded, so so and pretty pricey. Tip: don't pay for valet parking which was something like â‚¬40 per night. You can park fro free on the streets opposite just a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the right balance of minimalism, pop, and loveliness”
Reviews.Author: dccymbal
Reviews.Content: Charming staff. A great clean room with delicious amenities (bottle of wine at check in does not hurt). Fabulous rocking roof top bar - a bit expensive but so worth it. Oh. and an 11 out of 10 comfortable bed... Love!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful. Great location”
Reviews.Author: 665kate
Reviews.Content: Booked as a mystery deal on expedia. They couldn't find our reservation, quickly sorted it out and upgraded us to a suite for the inconvenience :) clean big suite. Friendly door and reception staff. Check out time of midday is awesome. Check out the rooftop bar too. One block from the beach and we even walked to Santa monica. close to Venice canals. Great if you wanna get out of down town la.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Hotels: One OK, One Great”
Reviews.Author: KevDough
Reviews.Content: I stayed a long weekend in May of 2011 at the Hotel Erwin in Venice as a stop between my trip from Boston to Maui. Though I'd been to Southern California numerous times, I had never really had a desire to stay in Venice as it's not really my style, but I booked via Hotwire in the Santa Monica area and got a good deal at the Erwin, about $125/night. When I arrived at the hotel, I was a little anxious as it really does have that eclectic, hipster feel to it and thusly fits in nice in the uber-cool Venice scene, and I'd go as far as to say this is the hotspot of the area. The parking in the area is tough, you gotta pay, but just sucking it up and using the valet is better than searching or paying for spots elsewhere. When I got to my room, I was disappointed, but not surprised to find that it was very run down and I had a great view of an AC vent with an alley backdrop. I sat there for a few minutes, cracked a beer, contemplated, and then went down to the front desk and asked for an upgrade. I was not upset, as I know as a frequent traveller and Hotwire junkie, when you get a great deal via these sites, the hotel is giving you the bottom of the barrel room, which is understandable. The young kid at the front desk gave me my upgrade options, I haggled for a few minutes per custom, and moved up to the 6th floor from the 2nd for a mere $20 more per night and got two free meals at "Hash" out of it as well. Now for the good part: I walk into my next room, on the totally refinished 6th floor and was in heaven. All new furnishings, beautiful partial ocean view, great bed, unbelievable shower/bath, and just the feeling that you went through a time machine from the late 90's to 2011 on the 4 floor ride up to the newer top portion of the hotel. This room was great, and a great deal to boot. Overall, this is a nice hotel either way. I'm not a big fan of Venice Beach, though I'm a party-type traveller in my 20's, as I like things a bit more high end and that isn't Venice Beach. The hotel is high-end, definitely, but not pretentious and suitable for most travelers, but mostly I'd say desirable for singles, couples, and folks looking to get a true L.A. beach party, surfer dude experience with the wacky Venice culture right out the back door. Hash was fine for what it is, very small restaurant with small plates and small menu, but big on quality and service. I had dinner there as well as breakfast and have no complaints. I walked through the rooftop bar "High" and it was very trendy, but it was May so a bit chilly for night, but the place was hopping and seemed like the cool place to be for locals. I bet it rocks during the summer. I'd certainly recommend this place, though I wouldn't stay in Venice again as it ain't my jive, man, but if you dig that atmosphere, power to ya.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not so expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lad_n_Sab
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Erwin. We went there after ready really good ratings on TA ans we were not disapointed - the service is good and the room as well - thoroughly cleaned and the breakfast at the bar is delicious - would definitly recommend (if you are looking for a laid back good hotel - if you are looking for top of the range 5*, go somewhere else)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: newjerseytraveler33
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Venice. 2 minutes to the beach, very clean and comfortable rooms. The decor is very funky and very Venice. The hotel is short walk (5-10 mins) to Abbott Kinney (the main drag in Venice with lots of cute shops and restaurants). The hotel is also about a 2 mile walk to the Santa Monica Pier (very doable- just wear sneakers!). The staff was great, very easy going, but attentive. They have parking available (valet only- $28 a day) which is very nice. If you don't mind walking a few minutes away, you can park your car on the street for free, just go down Market St. or any street near Abbott Kinney and check the parking signs, it is not tough to find! The hotel roof bar is amazing, the views are literally breathtaking! Try and stop up early evening, it gets a little trendy, so dress accordingly! Overall I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Santa Monica/Venice area.

Reviews.Title: “A modern funky hotel in slightly dated Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: CtheK
Reviews.Content: This is a funky, recently updated hotel in what was an slightly dated building in slightly dated Venice Beach. The rooms are spacious with bright colours (like a modern take on the 70s) and modern fittings (plasma screen, iPod stereo, etc). The roof terrace bar is a major attraction and attracts a young crowd from across LA, not just guests from the hotel. While Venice Beach itself is a bit on the seedy and dated side, Abbot Kinney with it's boutiques and modern restaurants and nightlife isn't far away. In the end, it was a great location to explore LA from and a great bolthole to get back to in the evening (or late at night). Breakfast is good and staff are friendly, although we had a bit of serious noise disturbance from our upstairs neighbours on Saturday night. They had a raucous party that lasted longer than we were out (3am) ;-)

Reviews.Title: “100% recommended”
Reviews.Author: DouglasHauser
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were driving from Vegas to San Diego last week and made a last minute decision to stop off in LA for a night, and found a cheap room at the Erwin via ebookers.com. We read the reviews on Tripadvisor, but you can never be totally sure... However, they are totally justified. Amazing hotel! Srsly cool. We had a kitchen and balcony and partial ocean view. The room was great and actually looked nicer than the photos - funky decor, perfectly clean, cool neon bathrobes, valet parking... TV, nice bathroom... The staff were really helpful, the location is cool, right on the beach, and 10 mins walk from Abbot Kinney (great coffee shops, boutiques and restaurants). I would totally stay there again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the surfers place!”
Reviews.Author: EllaInTheSky
Reviews.Content: We booked this place after a road trip to Las Vegas and were not disappointed, we absolutely loved the surfer laid-back atmosphere of the hotel and its very commited staff! We had a room big enough for the three of us, it was clean and functional with enough place for three shopping-mad girls and their 1000 bags. And how we enjoyed drinks in the evenings on the rooftop bar overlooking Venice Beach... a wonderful place to watch the sunset! Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Erwin - great location, fun place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gretelz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erwin was affordably priced and the location could not be beat, as the hotel has views on three sides overlooking the beach. Rooms nicely decorated and boutique like. The staff was wonderful, very friendly. Miguel checked us in and was great. I did pay a little extra for an ocean view room and it was worth it. We did have drinks at the bar on the roof top. I would suggest making a reservation as it fills up quickly. We also had breakfast in the hotel restaurant...it was delicious. Recommend eating at a place called "Larry's", very near the hotel. You must try the "brusel sprout pizza"....it is amazing! Overall, great location, great price, great food at hotel & nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: ichuk
Reviews.Content: Pretty satisfied with the hotel. It is very close to ocean, the stuff is friendly, rooms are clean. I would not recommend this place for couples, the area is not very nice in the evening. Don't use their own online booking system, when I arrived they couldn't find my reservation ) Another thing I didn't like, internet is not free ( Awesome bar on the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SoCal Fun”
Reviews.Author: h20babyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erwin is the best hotel in Venice. Let's face it, Venice is very eclectic and the locals are interesting. If you are not comfortable with "weird" people and street performers, the city of Venice is not for you. That's the character of the city. But the hotel has nothing to do with the people of Venice. We had a great time once we moved away from the main strip. The hotel staff were friendly and provided us with great service. The restaurant at the hotel just revamped their menu so we tried a lot of the entrees. The truffle fries are good, even the pickled egg salad was good. The burger was amazing! We have stayed with Hotel Erwin every time we have come to Venice and have never been disappointed. Hi Lounge provides an exceptional view of the city and I definitely recommend going there. And I definitely recommend Hotel Erwin.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kgari
Reviews.Content: Had a really good stay for 3 nights. Great staff. Very good rooftop bar. Comfortable rooms. My only criticism -no continental breakfast as part of the room rate. Venice Beach is a bit of a freak show, so depends what you want. Santa Monica as a location, may suit older travellers better.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, laid back hotel in the heart of Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: lwwylam
Reviews.Content: Spent three days here recently on a business trip and was surprised at how restorative and pleasant the time was in such a beautiful location. Hotel Erwin attracts hip young film industry types and other creative professionals. The hotel is just above Venice's Ocean Walk, so ocean view rooms and the rooftop lounge have gorgeous views of sandy beach and colorful local residents. High, the rooftop bar, is an elegant and comfortable setting for cocktails and light snacks, with heaters to balance the cool evening temperatures. On weeknights the bar closes early, so no worries about noise, though from the 6th floor rooms you can definitely hear the music and people, so the midnight closing time on weekends is much appreciated. The hotel restaurant, Barlo, is a new concept, a farm-to-table resto with a limited selection of locally sourced, artisan dishes and premium cocktails. Breakfast fare is a bit less exotic but very good and fairly priced for the area. Comfort and cleanliness of the room were both top notch. Keurig coffee machines, minibars stocked with top-shelf liquor and tempting snacks, big screen tv and good cable and movie selections, though the local scene provides all the entertainment anyone could want. Service was excellent and consistently professional. Hotel Erwin showed us a whole new side of LA, one that made me fall in love with the city and want to go back. More of an adult oriented scene - I don't remember seeing a single child during the time we were here - but a great place for couples or solo business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, can only recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ride_and_Travel
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay there for two nights but we loved the suite so much that we cancel led our other booking to stay at the Erwin for the rest of our holidays in LA. The style of the room is great, very 70's, very california, really cool.The staff is super friendly and the bar on the roof is a must go (don't forget your jumper, you will be on top of the building facing the ocean so it is always cold up there). The only thing we found a little cheap was to charge for the internet wifi but withour asking they removed it from our bill so nothing to complain about! Will definitely go back at the Erwin whenever I go back to Venice beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay - Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: AndrewB_PHX
Reviews.Content: While it was only a one night stay, we were thoroughly impressed with this little jewel in Venice Beach. The hotel was clean, the AC was cold, the view of the boardwalk and ocean from the small outdoor space was fantastic. As soon as we checked in we immediately felt a part of the Venice beach scene. There is a rooftop lounge called â€œHighâ€� that really picks up at night, but is also the best spot to watch the sunset from. You can get a reservation from through UrbanSpoon.com or calling them direct at (424) 214-1062. The Hotel Erwin is just steps from some great â€œsmall plateâ€� locally sourced food in addition to its own small restaurant. Room service for breakfast was extremely fast, accurate and tasty. Eat out on your patio and watch Venice Beach wake up!

Reviews.Title: “Erwin knows how to treat their guests.”
Reviews.Author: momzilla38
Reviews.Content: Spent my birthday weekend at Erwin. They made me feel like a rock star! Everyone from housekeeping to management goes out of their way to make sure my stay is always great. They are helpful, will give suggestions on places to go and what to see. If you have any questions or needs, all you have to do is ask...if they don't ask you first.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at it's best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovemytrvl
Reviews.Content: Stay in the heart of the Venice boardwalk. Me and my husband love it here! We try to come at least once a year! Venice is such an awesome place we love it and the hotel is the best!!!! A California must do! Doesn't get more LA than this

Reviews.Title: “JUST RIGHT”
Reviews.Author: Boeingdriver29
Reviews.Content: Simply the best place to really get the Venice Beach experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a hotel of this standard”
Reviews.Author: TravelloverLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erwin for three nights as part of a longer trip to California. On arrival the valet parking was efficient and reception staff were friendly. However, once we saw our room - small, no safe, very old fashioned bathroom, view on to a busy road - we were surprised, given the pictures on the website. The staff were helpful and moved us to a much larger room with a safe and more modern bathroom. However, we then found that building work was taking place directly under the room, which started at 8.30am on each of the three mornings. There was also a lift shaft in the room, which we assume took snacks up to the bar from the kitchen - this rattled away until about 10.30pm. In between this, the road outside was very noisy with deliveries being made in the side alley at 4.30am one morning! The location of the hotel is very good for Venice Beach but you can't actually get into the hotel from the beach, you go round the front which is not the most picturesque to say the least. There is a little patio to eat/drink but you are basically sitting on a main road so we ate in the restaurant one evening - we were the only guests and one of the five main courses was unavailable. They were upgrading the restaurant so this may have improved now. The roof top bar has impressive views. However, you need to book a table since when we went up (on a Tuesday night) it was completely full and we couldn't sit down - although locals seemed to be squeezed in! The hotel were apologetic about the noise and did give us a refund on our valet parking, which we appreciated. However, we'd have preferred a hotel where we could get a nice meal and a good night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “A must-stay destination in Venice Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Erwin for several out-of-town guests visiting on business, and I received nothing but spectacular service from the staff. There were several last-minute changes, all of which were accommodated with ease and efficiency. While dropping off items at the front desk for my guests, I witnessed first hand the superior customer service Hotel Erwin offers. From the minute you pull in to the driveway, to the wait staff at High, to the minute you check out, Hotel Erwin provides nothing but the best. Whether you are travelling for business or pleasure, I highly recommend Hotel Erwin- you won't find a better place in Venice Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and cool vibe!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleR88
Reviews.Content: Great rooms; awesome service; short walk to the beach, eating, bars and fun!! The view from the high bar was gorgeous too.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: kirsantacruz
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably friendly and helpful staff, great location! Loved HIGH BAR for sunset!!! The Erwin has the most comfortable beds ever! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The High Lounge and Bar was to die for!"”
Reviews.Author: dgion
Reviews.Content: From the first moment we arrived to the moment we left, the staff made every effort to create a calm, welcoming atmosphere at Hotel Erwin. The Hash Restaurant and the High Lounge are a surprise of veritable delights making it difficult to choose in what to indulge.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant jewel- perfectly situated-the place to be in Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: mschref
Reviews.Content: Upon your arrival at the front desk you will see a web cam view of the beach just beyond the hotel (it is very enticing- I found myself going into "de-stress" mode the moment I saw it). The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was immaculate - a very important consideration for me in any place I select while traveling. The bathroom was huge and the hot water plentiful (also a very important consideration for me). The bed was uber-comfortable (seriously, if the beach wasn't so enticing you might want to stay in for a bit )-- the view from the balcony was magnificent but not to be outdone by the view on the rooftop bar. I understand that this is THE place to be as the sun sets-- there are heated lamps (which are very welcome as Venice Beach nights can be quite chilly) and there is something a bit magical up there with the music playing - the people watching and the sun setting. A few tips for travelers to Venice Beach and beyond: the hotel does offer in-room service and has a restaurant right on the premises but we chose to wander about and explore the neighborhood. If you head right and make a left on Washington Street, there is a neat breakfast place to hang out in where it seems all the locals go to (I think it's called the Cow Barn or something like that)- reasonably priced and healthy. We strolled down Venice Beach (which is easy in the early morning and much more congested and lively mid-day). Santa Monica beach and pier has a totally different feel and ambiance-- both are definitely worth doing-- after the Santa Monica Pier (which has a carousel ) stride east to the Promenade which is a car-less place to roam and shop-- you can then head south to a unique outdoor mall which has a place my daughter insisted that we visit- a self-serve frozen yogurt place (glad we followed her advice; this place is amazing!). Following further south on Main, there are interesting boutiques to window shop. There was a great place to have dinner on Main- (sorry, forgot the name) that offers an incredible number of draft ales and beer and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Event”
Reviews.Author: kristinalevsky
Reviews.Content: I just had my birthday one the rooftop of Hotel Erwin and I can't say enough about the venue and overall experience. I worked with the events team, who were just amazing, to put together a party for 15 friends. The catering was wonderful, the hotel put together a specialty cocktail for my group that was delicious! If you haven't been to the rooftop, it's a must-see. From the outside of the hotel, you would never know what a gem sits on top, with the most breathtaking views of the ocean both to the east bay and Santa Monica, and Pacific Palisades. Definitely recommend the Erwin for any events.

Reviews.Title: “No more hotel jumping in Venice Beach/Santa Monica - I found my 'one!'”
Reviews.Author: KarinAmbrose
Reviews.Content: The incredible location is just the beginning, from the moment you enter the staff at this chic boutique hotel makes you feel at home. Super-close to the Venice Boardwalk it was easy to rent a bike and ride to Santa Monica. The Hotel Erwin is close to amazing dining in Venice, Santa Monica and Marina Del Ray. A really perfect spot to enjoy some of the best of So. California. Check-in was quick and easy and the suite I stayed in was very comfortable and well-appointed. The wet bar was complete with dishes and silverware and I loved the sunglasse honor bar offering! The pillows and bedding were incredible and made for a very good night's sleep. The large and fluffy towels were the only thing that could have lured me out of the shower. Great rain shower head and perfect water pressure. Each room has it's own balcony with seating - but for a night out the rooftop lounge, HIGH was a great place to grab handcrafted cocktail and mingle with tourists and locals alike. One one particiular evening in addition to the heaters we were offered blankets to make our expeirence more enjoyable. It seems that no attention detail was omitted at Hotel Erwin. I have found "my" place in Venice Beach!

Reviews.Title: “best option in venice for character, clean and value”
Reviews.Author: MollieBCasey
Reviews.Content: Opted to stay here instead of Santa Monica for a work event this past week. Such a great value, just a 5 min drive or pleasant walk to SM but also near Main St, Abbot Kinney, right on the water, and on a great corner in Venice with amazing empanadas, vegan options, vintage stores and coffee. The staff was very accomodating, the rate for the space we received was a deal and I slept like a baby. Lots of excitement outside but couldn't hear a word of it. I'll be back for sure, the other options nearby are either way over priced or without the character.

Reviews.Title: “High times in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ONEWINGNUT
Reviews.Content: The room had a nice view of Santa Monica....but room too small for price ...the bar on the top of the roof called HIGH was loud at times ...and the drinks were 12.50 for a whiye russian....BAR VERY LAME

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -super super close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: HareKrsna
Reviews.Content: It really was in the perfect location. Small grocery store super close. The Seed- a vegan restaurant right across the street from the hotel. I think the beach itself was only 1-2 short blocks away. Nice staff. The not so good info is-$28 a night to park at this hotel. I didn't rent a car because everything I needed was within walking distance. The Buses are cheap. When I arrived my refrigerator was full of their high priced products-juices and booze. I asked them to remove everything out of the refrigerator so I could put my stuff in it. They immediately came to my room and got all of the stuff out of the refrigerator. In the room they also have a box of expensive treats-chocolates-nuts, snacks. That did help me out when I arrived late at 11:30pm at night and was hungry. However those treats were super expensive for me to consume. I will stay at this hotel again in the future. There is no air conditioning or fans on the ceilings in the rooms. You have to leave your patio door open to breathe during the summer. Don't expect to sleep at night. Lots of noise from the street scene in the alley plus there is a noisy bar right next door. If you just want to hang out at the beach this is the best place to go. Be sure to book your reservation on line way ahead of time as this hotel is very pricey. If you sign up on line early they are much less expensive. I got a room with a view of the alley. You have to pay extra to get an ocean view. But believe me, the alley can be super interesting late at night. Don't go out super early in the mornings. Most of the little stores don't open till 9 or 9:30am. Of course, it is Venice Beach and there are a lot of homeless people in this area.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Location, 3 Star Hotel, 1 1/2 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkieab
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Erwin in Venice Beach for 2 nights at the beginning of August. Unfortunately it was one of the worst hotel stays I've ever experienced. I don't even know where to begin, as the hotel seemed to be plagued with issues. From the minute I arrived, it was complete chaos. I waited 20-25 minutes just to arrive at the entrance. The driveway was so small, and the lack of attendants and organization was the precursor for what I experienced throughout my stay. As I was arriving from a different part of LA, I ended up arriving at 1:30 pm. When i approached the front desk, I was told that my reservation could not be found even though I had a confirmation number (which they said was not relevant at all). A supervisor was summoned, who seemed to find the reservation in short order. After finding the reservation, I was told that there was no room ready for me, and that check in was not available until 3 pm. (It is in their policies). The same supervisor asked housekeeping to prepare a room immediately, which I still did not get into until after 3pm. I was only travelling with a carry-on, so with some hesitation I left my bag with the valet. Later on during my stay, I actually overheard that the hotel valet's had actually given guests the wrong luggage upon departure who returned it to the hotel. All of this, wasn't even the beginning of the problems. The biggest issue occurred while enjoying the beach in the morning. Upon returning to the room at around 2 pm after some great surf to get cleaned up, there was a note placed on the bed stating that from 12-6 pm there would be no water in any of the hotel rooms, not to mention that housekeeping had not yet been to the room. There was no prior notification whatsoever, for an inconvenience such as this, making this completely unacceptable. How do you not inform guests that they simply cannot shower, drink, go to the bathroom etc for the duration of most the day??? I contacted the front desk immediately and was very displeased to say the least. Solutions were very slow to come, which therefore inconvenienced me further. Their solution was to make shower facilities in another part of the hotel available, as well as compensate me with 1 complimentary drink upstairs on the roof patio. You have to question priorities, when guests are inconvenienced due to a very poorly planned water outage, which turned out to be part of a restaurant renovation. Later I chose to pursue the matter with the operations manager, who did apologize, and comped that day's stay. The hotel itself is dated and is aged considerably. There is only 1 elevator throughout the entire hotel, some of the carpets are quite dirty, there was scuff and dirt marks throughout the hallways, musty odours were prevalent, the tile on the bottom of the shower was not cleaned well, and wearing away etc. The furniture in the room looked worn, and our room didn't even have an alarm clock in it. It feels very 60's, and needs a new style of funk. Some modern upgrades and decor do exist, but is not carried throughout the entire hotel. It's in desperate need of a complete remodelling job. Also as a side note, they do advertise every room with a balcony, just be prepared that your balcony may be 18 inches wide. I ordered room service for breakfast on my final morning, and it was just average, and albeit somewhat cold. I had been told it would take 30 minutes, and did not receive food for well over an hour. This just once again isn't acceptable. (They did give me a free glass of OJ for the waitâ€¦) Yes the location is great, and there are some nice ocean views, but this was just a terrible overall experience. The staff were indeed very nice, and accommodating but did not seem to have the resources to deal with the issues. They couldn't even provide me with the correct directions to LAX upon departure. Even as a non-resident I realized that the directions were incorrect, and had to refer to a map. As a very frequent traveller to California, and a patron of boutique hotels, my preference still remains elsewhere. I would not stay here again, nor recommend it, and it would now be a challenge to choose to stay in ANY Joie de Vivre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The centre of it all in Venice, CA”
Reviews.Author: Cupcakedujour
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Erwin lived up to every review I read, and every good thing I'd heard about it! We were given premium treatment from the moment we pulled up to the front doors, until our departure the next day. The valet service was efficient and affordable, and the staff who greeted us at our car were very polite and helpful. At the front desk we were greeted by a friendly and gregarious gentleman, who invited us to "sing for our room" and gave a heartfelt example of how to do so. Our room was very large, light, comfortable, and beautifully and artfully decorated. Every inch of it was designed to inspire, please and captivate. It fully captured all the spirit and energy of the beach, and was a terrific addition to our visit there. This hotel is literally in the middle of everything! We were very pleased with how easy it was to reach from the highway, and how close it was to the beach, and the famous four corners in Venice. While we didn't have the time to enjoy the pool deck, I did run up to check it out, and it was every bit as lovely as I'd heard it was! On my next visit I will be sure to take full advantage of it. Our stay was part of a very special Birthday celebration, and to this day, we talk about how well this hotel complimented our experience. I would happily plan my next trip to LA around staying at the Erwin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - loved the suite for our family”
Reviews.Author: MacqueenSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Erwin recently and although it was not our first choice in Venice Beach, we were really impressed with the facilities of the property. As we were a family of 5, we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, there was more than enough room for all of us, we had 1 separate bedroom with lovely comfortable king size bed, and really good linen and pillows on the bed... Our children (3 teenage girls), shared 1 queen sized sofa bed, and we also had a roll away bed. Only down side with this was the rollaway mattress was really thin and so bed a bit uncomfortable, but hey, she's 12 and didn't care all that much!! There's 1 bathroom, but good size with nice amenities. We could see Venice Beach from our room, plus we had a small deck which was nice. All in all the room was super comfortable (oh, and it had a kitchen too!), and the price was right - much cheaper than taking 2 rooms (which we had done everywhere else..). The rooftop bar was a perfect spot to finish off a great day in LA, and do a bit of people spotting, and the restaurant downstairs - served a fantastic breakfast with great service.. The area the hotel is in is slightly dingy, but it is Venice Beach, and there are a lot of shady people around, so I guess that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for those who love to party”
Reviews.Author: nancylarry
Reviews.Content: There are alot of mixed reviews on this hotel, I see. This was our first time in Venice, and upon arrival, (once we found the hotel - it's a little hidden) we were concerned about the neighborhood. It is right near the main crossroads of the boardwalk & beach. And the crowd is funky! A real crosssection of humanity come to the boardwalk in Venice. But we knew that before we got there so we were fine with it. The hotel was formerly the Best Western and has been updated into a hip hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly upon arrival, and we were upgraded to a ocean view room. The valet parking is extra and steep at $28 a nite. The room was on the sixth floor and was large and very nice. The downside though, to being on the 6th floor is that you are right below the nightlclub 'High" and you can hear the thumping in the room and the hallway. We moved from right below the DJ to a room at the opposite end of the hall, and that was much better. We went up to "High' for a sunset drink and it is a great spot with a fabulous view of the water and the town. It is a very strange set up though. There are a limited number of seats and you have to reserve ahead of time. There are no bar seats just a small area for those who did not reserve a seat - standing room only. The drinks are very expensive also. There is no place in the immediate area for a nice dinner, it's a little sketchy in the evening with the homeless crowd, but Abbot Kenney Blvd is not too far away to walk. Really great shops and restaurants in that area. Our big problem came when we returned to the hotel after dinner. Apparently there is no security doors from the stairway doors to the room floors and customers coming up to the rooftop bar can wander around the hallways. We encountered a crowd of shirtless hip hop guys and their girls roaming our hallways laughing and yelling. There was a party going on in the room next to us and there was door slamming and yelling in the halls til 3am. When I woke in the morning, I found that our next door neighbors had jumped the barrier on our deck and used our outdoor chairs to accomodate their party. This was all a bit disconcerting to say the least. When I told the front desk in the am, we were comped breakfast, which was very nice, but frankly, we should have had that night comped by the corporate sponsor of the room next door (Red Bull). I can't say that I recommend the place, unless you really enjoy the party scene, which kicks in on the weekends. Probably best to stay here on a weekday. I recommend to the manager that non hotel guests be kept out of the hotel floors. It is really a very nice hotel, but be aware of the crowd this type of hip hotel attracts.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhDAndie
Reviews.Content: From the location to the decor this hotel is a little piece of hipster heaven. Lucky for us it's just what we were looking for. The room was spacious and had really cool furnishings, and the beds were comfortable. Unfortunately the bathroom left a lot to be desired. The tub was tiny and the toilet was behind a frosted glass door (zero privacy)! We tried the Hash restaurant for brunch which was quite good and relatively reasonable. The location was good in the daytime (minutes from the beach) but sketchy at night, and walkable evening food options were limited (not the fault of the hotel but something to be aware of). We got a very reasonable deal on this property through Expedia and felt that the value for what we paid was good, however if we were paying the rack rate we would likely have been disappointed. Next time we're in the area we'd probably stay in Santa Monica instead of Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “If you like incessant thuding all night long this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: sleeplessinvenice
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend stay. The Hotel is one block from the heart of Venice Beach, which is good and bad. The traffic getting into and out of the hotel is horrific on the weekends. Expect to spend 20 to 30 minutes to go a mile in the area. The rooms are essentially spiffed up versions of a Best Western type of hotel. The real issue is the noise. We cold never quite figure out what it was, we think it was the public bathrooms on the 5th floor or the stairwell, but all day and night long it was like elephants jumping up and down above us. Seriously, if you want to sleep, pick another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Escaping the Madness of carmegeddon"”
Reviews.Author: ejohanson007
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. My wife n i decided a couple months ago to escape the potential traffic madness of the 405 freeway closure on the july 14-15 wknd, so we wanted to try the Hotel Erwin in venice beach. We had heard great things about it but wanted to experience it for ourselves n we couldnt have been happier. From the time we checked in to the time when we checked out, everything was great. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful with all our needs. I would definitely recommend that anyone staying @ the Erwin, or even elsewhere in the area, make time to go to the rooftop lounge n bar called High. It has the most amazing view of the pacific ocean on the westside. You are 7 stories up on the front and can see both north and south as far as the eye can see. I have stayed at some of the hotels in Santa Monica but never in venice. The hotel had all the modern conveniences of a nice hotel without all the atitude, that's very refreshing. I would definitely recommend any and all to stay @ the Erwin n get a true taste of Venice Beach and all that it has to offer. We will definitely be back sooner than later, Eric.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Trainwreck.”
Reviews.Author: VoyageurK
Reviews.Content: Wow. I have no idea how one hotel can provide so much incompetence. Unhelpful corporate reservations staff who provide inaccurate information. Preferred guest amenities that are promised and not delivered. Best Rate Guarantee submission ignored. At check-in, receptionist informed us that rooftop bar served food until 11PM. At 10:40, we were informed that they had made a "last call" at 10:20 and no food was available. No solutions offered by staff whose attitude seemed to be a surfer like "bummer, dude." Filthy hallways. Unvacuumed room. And--get this--a half bag of cocaine lying next to the nightstand. Seriously?!? Do I have to look in the sheet for used condoms as well?!? No Manager available at 9:30AM to address these and other issues. Chaotic, understaffed front desk. Receptionists unable to direct other guests to Malibu. Answer? Go out to Lincoln Avenue, turn left, and follow Route 1. I know that and I don't even live there! Just one comic mistake after another with no redeeming qualities at all. OK, the view from the roof is nice at night. But absolutely no reason to stay here. Have a drink at the roof top (don't plan on eating though!) and then head back to any other hotel in the greater Los Angeles area. You'll thank me for skipping the Erwin; utter Hipster Hell.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LittleManTW
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Erwin in Venice Beach California visiting a relative who had just had a baby. The GM upgraded me to a suite to honor the occasion and I must say that the combination of proximity to the beach and central Venice, the price, the decor and the friendliness of the staff make this one of the best all-around hotel experiences I have ever had. The rooftop bar HIGH was the icing on the cake. BEST views and drinks in the area and there is seriously no better place to watch the sun sink into the Pacific than there. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: CaJen27
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! From the moment that we walked into the hotel we were greeted by the friendly and extremely accommodating staff. Every employee we encountered was fantastic. Loved the restaurant Hash and the rooftop lounge HIGH has the most amazing views of the ocean and the city. The hotel is close to so much. We were able to walk to the beach, Abbott Kinney, Main Street, Santa Monica Pier, Marina Del Rey. There were shops and restaurants galore all around us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and next time Iâ€™m in Venice you can bet that I will be staying at Hotel Erwin!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the place”
Reviews.Author: beachguy4
Reviews.Content: I picked the Erwin because my brother was renting a house in Venice and we wanted to be nearby. The reviews on the Erwin were mixed but my wife and I took a chance. We really loved the Erwin. It has been fully remodeled and is steps to the beach and the boardwalk in Venice. It is an eclectic style - don't expect a Marriott - but it has real charm and warmth. There are big screen HDTV's in the room, the furniture and bedding is excellent and the rooms are clean. The staff is terrific and gave us an early check-in and late check-out on a busy weekend. They have a little restaurant on site called Hash that we didn't get to try but seemed to be a very popular place. They also have a rooftop club for drinks and appetizers. The only negative I can think of it that there is only one elevator and 6 floors, so the wait can be a few minutes at certain times of the day. Venice can be a zoo in the summer but the Erwin gives you a wonderful place to relax and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jbk999
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a young couple or singles although very pricey. The room we had was lovely but the hotel was very loud (there is a bar on the roof). The elevators were slow and always packed with people. I stayed here with 2 teens and the location was great. Just a block off the boardwalk and close enough.to Marina Del Rey and Santa Monica to walk to (if you like long walks!). The staff was grear and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Funky Venice Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Snowpatroller
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Erwin appears to be a converted apartment building in Venice, CA. The surrounding neighborhood is fine by day but becomes sketchy at night. There are a lot of homeless/street people in the area and you will be constantly be approached by people asking for money. I did not feel comfortable walking around the neighborhood at night so I got in the car and drove to Santa Monica for activity after dark. The rooms are satisfactory however the bathrooms are are not enclosed so you should be very comfortable with your partner if you are sharing a room. This property is really geared for young people who want to stay in the area and who have a high tolerance for noise. The hotel is located very close to the adjacent apartment buildings and the streets are narrow which results is a lot of noise in the morning.
