Do not plan on being able to sleep late as the noise level from the hotel corridors and the outside activity makes it very difficult to sleep in the morning. I reserved a partial ocean view room which did provide a narrow view of the ocean but the view was dominated by the apartment building directly across a narrow street. Overall, I was disappointed and for the price I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel, great rooftop bar!”
Reviews.Author: Sara L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with friends at the end of my travels. It was a great hotel. Admittedly the view if you looked down into the alley did not amount to much, but the view of Venice Beach was great. The room was get clean. The rooftop bar has to make the hotel perfect. We happily sat and watched the world go bar. It had great music abd excellent staff. The staff were very helpful throughout, offering us sone great restaurant recommendations. I would definitely advise asking them. We were also walking distance to the canals which are a stunning walk. A great place to stay in the middle of Venice Beach!

Reviews.Title: “funky, quirky hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: proseccoqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May in a one bedroom suite which was huge. Miguel at front desk gave us a room when we arrived at 9.00am after long flight from Australia - this was very much appreciated. Venice Beach has seen better days but if you walk about 5 minutes inland from the hotel you will find Abbot Kinney Blvd which has fabulous shops and restaurants and the best coffee outside Australia at Intelligentsia. The Erwin Hotel also has a lovely rooftop bar and barbecue and a small bar and breakfast room on the ground floor called Hash. Good location, not too far from LAX and a pleasant walk to Santa Monica Beach. The staff were very helpful at all times and I would recommend this hotel to younger people particularly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Erwin”
Reviews.Author: ForestFan
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long drive from Vegas on our recent trip from the UK. We were given a complementary room upgrade as we are members of the Joy of Life Club and a bottle of wine in our room which is a really nice touch. We originally planned to stay for only one night before moving to the Angelino, but we liked the vibe and location of the Erwin so much we asked Eugene, on the front desk, if we could transfer our booking for the rest of our stay, before we flew back home. Eugene went above and beyond, and made a call to make the arrangements and managed to get the cancellation charge waived. Everything ran smoothly and we had confirmation e-mails in our inbox within the hour. The following morning, Miguel was on front desk duties and helped us check out and check back in, even keeping the same room and rate, so there was no impact on us at all. He also helped with directions downtown and local bike hire. These two guys are a credit to the hotel and helped make our stay at the Erwin perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, hair-y hotel digs"”
Reviews.Author: na711cho
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I'm a huge fan of Joie de Vivre properties in California and certainly plan to stay at many of them when I travel to the west coast as they have been amazing. This hotel was a big let down for JdV and I certainly wouldn't stay here again for anything over $99/night. Stayed here for the Easter Holiday weekend and checked in around 7pm. The outside of the hotel is pretty stereotypical Venice Beach. Some trendy signage, but a run down and dirty exterior. Right on if you ask me, I love Venice! Things sadly went down from here, Valet was running terribly behind and since the load in area is a quarter-circle drive, this makes it cramped and somewhat dangerous for loading/unloading. The check-in was also very slow and behind. Certainly happens, but for the weekend I was there, not a time went by whenI walked by the front desk that it wasn't under-staffed or without someone waiting. No exaggeration here, but I will say, in true JdV style, once they become available, the staff is very friendly! Once checked-in and in the room, the big shock was just how dirty the place was. Being a regular traveler, and certainly far from stuck-up, I can deal with the average hotel let-downs that inevitably happen with frequent travel, but this place was a disaster. Literally hairs were all over the place. The carpet smelled really bad as did the furniture, and the lighting was so poor in every nook but the bathroom area that it almost seemed planned as to hide the "nasty's" that are certainly apparent with full daylight. Had it not been so late, and with our little one already asleep, I didn't make the move to get another room and haggle with the front desk as who knows what the wait would have been. If you have made it all the way to the end of this review, I'll just mention that the bar on the roof is the reason to visit this place. Make it a stop for your night on the town, but unless you are stumbling to find a bed, skip this hotel until they remodel or at least deep clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sun - Style - Sensational Service!”
Reviews.Author: BittyBubbles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Erwin is perfectly located to everything fun and relaxing on the Westside! Only steps away from the beach, bike paths and less than 15 minutes away from all the shopping, spas and restaurants one can ask for made for an exciting get away! The staff at the Hotel Erwin was approachable, friendly and incredibly accommodating during my weekend visit! :) I enjoyed a healthy yet tasty breakfast at Hash to bubbles and sinful bites on the rooftop at night :) and loved that I can walk off my indulgences during my stay on the eye candy Venice boardwalk!! Marina Del Rey and Santa Monica are also all walking and biking distances from hotel. Of course for those who desire little exercise on your trips ...its only an 8 - 15 cab ride to either cities..which made it very nice on the nights we weren't playing on the roof top. The hotel decor is reflective of the bright, beach, and eclectic Venice lifestyle and the beds were oh so comfortable and the rooms very spacious. Stylish but not stuffy! All in all fantastic getaway with my friends!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: rhonda2460
Reviews.Content: we stayed at The Erwin last weekend for 1 night wish we could have stayed longer. The staff was awesome. Rooms were great and bed so comfy The view was amazing. loved every minute of our stay

Reviews.Title: “Beachy, cute, low-maintanance seeks same!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogoer
Reviews.Content: I was in a laid-back mood on this vacation, so it didn't really bother me to discover....the hot water heater was out! The staff was extremely apologetic about it, had contractors in non-stop to fix it, and offered a set-aside room that did have hot running water, where guests could reserve time slots & keys to shower. I was promised a satisfactory discount upon checkout, and this was forthcoming without me having to even mention it. The location is great, decor is cute, price is affordable. Venice and Santa Monica are quite pedestrian-friendly, compared with L.A. proper; I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to go (such as to a hairstylist to get a shampoo and blowout). Note: do check on the supply of caffeinated vs. decaf coffee pods before you go to sleep; our decaf was replenished every day but we had to ask for caffeinated ones.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Spacious Room and Great Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: peterrabbit33
Reviews.Content: My wife, new born, and I stayed in Venice beach for one night, but wish we were there longer. We reserved a one bedroom suite which was colorfully decorated and had a great view of the beach. The beds were comfortable and we wish it was colder the night we stayed, because we would have used the fireplace. We did not eat at Hash or have a drink at High, but overheard a guest raving about the food. So it must be good! Everyone was friendly and provided us with the information we needed to get around - find Starbucks, the reatuarant we were meeting friends at, and refuel are car. The bellmen were quick and friendly. I highly reccomend staying here if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with lots of charm and amazing roof top lounge!”
Reviews.Author: KelseyPRed
Reviews.Content: I work in travel and have stayed at many hotels in my line of work, and I can't say enough good things about my stay at the Hotel Erwin. You can't beat the location right next to Venice Beach. Also, the rooftop bar called High, had spectacular views of the ocean and city. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Lastly, the beds are extremely comfortable and the brunch in their restaurant 'Hash' hit the spot right before spending the day walking around Venice. Two thumbs up for Hotel Erwin. Check out some of the street performers on the boardwalk in Venice. I saw a man jump over 10 other spectators! It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at Hotel Erwin”
Reviews.Author: tomman25
Reviews.Content: The staff was very professional, kind and courteous and everyone seemed to be genuinely happy. The room that I stayed in was absolutely amazing. The Hotel is classy and has a rooftop bar. Couldn't make it up there during their hours but appeared to be cool. The location is unbeatable - less than a block away from Venice Beach - and the balcony had a great view of the beach (it helped that the weather was great). While the room wasn't ready for an early check-in, there was maybe a ten minute wait (that was spent walking to the beach) and it was all ready. I highly recommend checking it out. Even if it is to go to the rooftop bar for a drink and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jpat24
Reviews.Content: Went to Venice for a friend's going away party and decided to stay at the hotel. Bed was great and got a good night's sleep after a long day in the sun. Awesome location and close to lots of restaurants and bars. High lounge (rooftop bar) was a great place to relax and soak in the nice weather. Will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and funky, great location & outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Amy777760
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at Hotel Erwin, the staff was friendly, attentive, and accomodating. When I arrived early in the am and they expedited my room. When I needed a place for my bike they stored it and locked it up for me. The room was neat and clean and overlooked the beach and I could walk everywhere I needed to go. Great place to stay, I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A gem by the beach”
Reviews.Author: producerNY
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business with a collegue (and then by myself). It was love, love, lovely to be able to get up in the morning and literally be 2 minutes from the Beach. I had a walk every morning on the beach and it certainly made the rest of my annoying work day seem a little more bearable. The staff is friendly -- and very sincerely so. I was there for about two weeks - although I travelled away both week end. I did feel like I was coming home. I stayed in two different types of rooms, both were clean and comfortable. I do wish they had bathtubs. It is very reasonably priced- which makes me think I could/would come back for personal trip. Even the stuff in the minibar isn't outrageously priced -- at about $3.00 for a little treat---you don't wake up with an empty candy wrapper and regret. The roofdeck is amazing views of Venice and the California Sunset puts on a little show every night. I got to know all the staff at Hash and enjoyed bellying up to the bar for breakfast and for a drink at night. I think the menus could definitely incorporate some healthier, lighter options but again not priced too high, so you don't feel like you are breaking the bank to order room service. And I would definitely recommend the Tasting Room and Gjelina on Abbot Kinney for dinner. Great food. It is not a full service luxury 24 hour room service -- but it still feels very luxurious to be staying right on the beach. Overall I was very satisfied and would recommend the hotel...which I was I decided to write this review, -- Hope you enjoy the hotel and staff as much as I did. -

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Experience, stylish hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: DHotel5
Reviews.Content: Several months ago, a friend of ours passed away. My wife and I ventured out to LA for his funeral and had no idea where to stay. A friend of ours recommended this hotel as it was less than 20 minutes to the funeral home. We were exhausted as we arrived late after a five hour drive from Las Vegas. Upon checking in, the front desk agent greeted us with a smile and wished us well on our visit. We were very pleased with the size of our room and our view of the ocean. Upon awakening we ate at the hotel cafe and really enjoyed our breakfast. We then walked down to the beach, which is a very short walk, to try and clear our heads and relax. We couldn't have been more pleased with our experience. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you Hotel Erwin for helping to create a nice experience during a very sad time in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Five star price-one star everything else!”
Reviews.Author: Bb427
Reviews.Content: Don't let the price fool you into believing there will be anything nice about your stay! Alot half of your time for waiting for their tiny ancient elevator-and the other half for waiting for whatever single person is running the entire hotel. I do love the location but would much rather stay somewhere it is possible to shower without receiving second degree burns! Don't bother having friends or family meet you in your room either-if you aren't paying for a room-you re not welcome there. There are no creature comforts at this hotel let alone benefits-I hate to rant but what a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for enjoying Venice”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoLP
Reviews.Content: After a business meeting I wanted a hotel on the beach for 2 days of relax. I decided to splurge and booked an ocean view room at the Erwin. It turned out I was initially given a room with a faint glimpse of the sea, but after complaining I was indeed given a room with ocean view. It turned out to be a very pleasant two-days stay. Room cleanliness could have been better, and the room was OK but nothing special -- but I decided I was willing to pay for the view. One is located at the center of the action in Venice, and beach access is, well, immediate. The roof top lounge is very pleasant, an excellent way to waste an evening in good company.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Erwin is the Good Karma Capitol of Venice Beach.”
Reviews.Author: ginacooper
Reviews.Content: Aside from the really comfy beds, the funky local art and the perfect convenience to the boardwalk, what makes the Hotel Erwin so special is its people. The bartenders and servers both up and downstairs were friendly and poured a generous glass of wine. The kitchen was accommodating to off-the-menu requests. The guy at the front desk was always ready with directions and a good restaurant recommendation. The folks at the front door were quick to welcome you back - and sometimes when the valet was busy talking to a guest or parking the car, that front door guy was the manager himself (who always seemed to be filling in somewhere when things got busy). And if that weren't enough, even the cleaning staff seemed happy. But the real test came after I checked out and realized that I had left my not so cheap sun glasses on the vanity back in my room. I thought for sure they were gone but I called the front desk and the woman who answered the phone said she'd get them for me. Could it be that I would actually get my glasses back? When I returned to the hotel I checked the front desk, but no glasses. They gave me another room key, and I ran upstairs to my room to see the cleaning guy finishing up. I asked if he had seen my glasses and he said no, but he thought he had heard something about them. "Yeah, I bet you have," I thought. So I went back down, talked to the manager who was offering to file an incident report when out of the office stepped the woman who had answered the phone. AND SHE HAD MY GLASSES! YAYYYYY! How could I have ever doubted you Hotel Erwin? Finding such an honest, well priced, comfortable and friendly hotel at a busy tourist destination is amazing. The Hotel Erwin will be my regular home base in LA from now on for sure:)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: For the money paid I expected more. Rooms are spacious but they are run down and smell like a cheap motel. The TV is small and beds could be better. I am not very picky but this hotel costs few bucks less than a nearby excellent 5 stars hotel and it is not even close in quality. I cannot recommended to either old or young travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcolter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Staff were all extremely helpful. Rooms were well kept and very unique. We had a problem with the door to our room and within minutes we were helped. Only stayed for one night and didn't eat in the restaurant so I can't comment there, but it all seemed great and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, Super Chic”
Reviews.Author: Randelel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend last week and couldn't have been happier with the hotel. It is in an AMAZING location, just across from Venice Beach. It also sports outstandingly gorgeous views in all directions from the Rooftop bar, High. We had a clear day, by LA standards, and could see all the way to the Hollywood sign and up to Santa Monica. The High is incredible. The drinks were excellent and the food equally as impressive. We enjoyed breakfast the next morning and our food arrived on time and piping hot. The King size bed was so comfortable we didn't want to leave. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a night away from the busy hustle and bustle of LA. It is a sanctuary of relaxation amidst the concrete jungle.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself ok, but BEWARE: REVIEW YOUR BILL CAREFULLY”
Reviews.Author: rnbowbrite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with several of my friends, in three different rooms, and we each separately had the same sketchy experiences with the hotel employees. First, even if you ask the hotel reception to call you a taxi, they will instead call a car service-- and then they will try to tell you that the car service would be the same price as a taxi. THIS IS A LIE. Once they quoted me a price that was a full $30 more than the taxi I ultimately took, claiming that a taxi would cost the same amount. Another time they quoted me a price that ended up being almost twice as much as the taxi I ultimately took-- again, lying to me and telling me that the taxi would be the same price. When I pointed out that I didn't think a taxi would cost as much as they quoted to me, they lied to me AGAIN, and told me that the base price for a taxi in LA was $6 (it's actually only $2.85). Two of my friends separately had the same experience with the same people. They clearly have some sort of deal with the car service next door. Second, the website and signs all over the hotel claim that they offer free wireless internet. THIS IS ALSO A LIE. When trying to use the internet, they will request that you either pay $5 to use the internet, or sign up for a login and password-- which also requires you to first pay $5, and takes several days to arrive. Also, the internet is so slow, that you really have to pay for the "second tier" wireless for it to be useful, which is $10. It would be one thing if they were upfront about this, but they have advertisements all over the place claiming that they have complimentary internet. When I complained to the hotel reception that we'd been forced to pay for the internet, they told me it was because the "complimentary" internet was $5, and the second tier was $10. I pointed out that "complimentary" does not mean $5, and they said I had signed up for the second tier of internet (which I had not). When I told them there was no option available to sign up for free internet, they told me they had no idea and took it off my bill-- only then I spoke with two of my other friends who had each separately gone through the same experience, and had the same conversation, with hotel reception. The hotel is perfectly nice-- but you really have to be careful with the review of your bill, and don't believe the hotel employees.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for twenty somethings”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: The Erwin is a good hotel for twenty somethings. I'm a fair bit older than that and it didn't feel like a good fit. In the (rather overworked) elevator, I encountered a group singing in unison, and, later, a guy trying to pick up all the cans of soda that fell out of a big box. I saw a group yelling off a balcony. High--the attractive bar on the roof--was getting heavy action on a Saturday late afternoon--but one look told me it wasn't for me. Having the rooftop bar meant a lot of people flowing into the hotel and up that elevator. The room itself was attractive, as Joie de Vivre properties usually are. The bed was big and comfortable. The first "partial view" room they gave me had virtually no view, but when I went back, they moved me up a floor and closer to the ocean, with a decent view. The bed was big and comfortable. There was an awful lot of selling going on in the room. There were the usual minibar snacks and a generous selection of liquor. There were non-food items for sale, including bandages, under a label something like "Oh I'm cut" (this is tasteless in about 10 different ways). There was a rack of sunglasses hung up in the room for sale, so you could achieve the proper Venice beach cool. Worst of all, wireless internet cost $4.95, I refused to use it. Unlike many cheaper hotels, they didn't have a public use computer in the lobby, though they didn't have much room there (not that this really bothers me, since most hotel lobbies seem to be just wasted space). Kudos for being retro enough to have a phone book--it's very handy and all hotels should do it. Venice is a curious mix of commercialized 60's counterculture and trendy contemporary yuppiedom. That said, it's still nice to be near the beach and the ocean, and though the winter weekend rate was almost $200, it's still less than it would have gone for in Santa Monica. I was also able to see a play 5 minutes' bus ride away. Transit is pretty good, there are frequent buses to Santa Monica, to Downtown LA (an hour plus ride), and other places like Westwood. There are numerous restaurants a few minutes' walk away on Abbott Kinney Blvd., there are a few right around the hotel. Oh, and the restaurant in the hotel, which I didn't eat in, is known as Hash. High and Hash, cuuute, suggestive names.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and super location.”
Reviews.Author: js51305
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem steps away from Venice Beach. The hotel has a cool vibe that is integrated very well with the surrounding area. My room was newly renovated, clean, spacious and included a balcony with views of the Pacific Ocean. The hotel was also extremely convenient. It was not far from LAX, steps away from great shopping, restaurants and provided easy access to the commercial areas of West LA. This is one of the few hotels in LA where you could be without a car.

Reviews.Title: “a happy camper”
Reviews.Author: lisa225
Reviews.Content: the hotel erwin is a pleasure from start to finish. a traveler's first impression of the hotel begins with the service staff at the door and front desk. i was immediately welcomed by the young man opening the door for me and the front desk staff was also warm and welcoming. no "attitude" here, as i've sometimes encountered in boutique hotels. i went to my suite and knew i had made the right choice. everything was clean, comfortable and felt like home. the living room couch was made for comfort and the bed was just right. i then went out to my balcony (ocean front) and fell in love with my view of the ocean and the sound of the surf. next, i went to the rooftop bar (as a weary traveler really needs a drink) and met esteban (bartender) and the staff. the drinks were great, the view amazing and the staff couldn't have been better. i ate at hash that night and found more of the same. good comfort food and the two young men working the bar and restaurant couldn't have been nicer. everyone i met working at this hotel (and i think i met everyone!) made such a positive impression on me, including the hard working housekeeping staff. even the gentleman they contract with to provide car service for their guests was great. i travel quite a bit, stay in many hotels and for many of them they have forgotten that they are in the "hospitality" business and what this word means. not the hotel erwin, whoever does the hiring and the training does a terrific job of choosing the staff and allowing them to enjoy their jobs. after all, if the people working there are not happy then their customers will not be happy that, to me, is hospitality. i will definitely be staying whenever i come to california and am planning an extended vacation there for a month next winter. as to the "grotty"street folk on the boardwalk, i actually got to know many of them by name during my very early morning walks on the boardwalk and had alot of laughs with them. i truly hope they don't change anything at this place (and the rates don't go up due to all this good press!). i know some people reading this might think this review is "too" glowing to be real,so i will come up with a negative, the temperature of the water in the shower changes suddenly... that's it! esteban, i am following the progress of your "wall" on your website you are very talented. thanks for everything, lisa

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a funky location”
Reviews.Author: RAKlein
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights at the tail end of a two week vacation (a Premium King). We were initially hesitant given some of the reviews, but were glad we overlooked concerns expressed by others. The hotel was clean and well maintained, the staff were attentive and sincerely interested in guests being happy, and the location (a block from Venice Beach) was perfect. We stayed on the 6th floor, facing south, toward the west end of the hall -- good view of the beach and of the sunrise. There's a rooftop bar on the seventh floor that is worth a visit (especially around sundown) and a restaurant on the first floor (Hash) where guests get 25% off -- good food and very fair prices. It is worth joining the Joie de Vivre frequent stayers program before arriving -- a complementary beverage (half bottle of wine is one option) and free wifi is provided to members. All in all, we were pleased with the property and would not hesitate to return, especially given its location at the centre of Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable chic in Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Krichdog
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay in my first Joie de Vivre Hotel, having heard about the boutique chain from family members. The Erwin Hotel was a great introduction to the JDV way, it's chic and stylish but still affordable. The location in Venice was hard to beat, 1 block from the boardwalk/beach and easy valet parking in a covered lot so you didn't have to worry about your car. The check in area was a little cramped, but the check-in process was very quick and soon we were up in our room. The room was fairly basic but it was roomy and had plenty of modern charm. The restaurant is cozy but they have good healthy food. One unexpected bonus was the sunglasses they had for sale in the room, we needed a pair so grabbed one and paid when we checked out. The rooftop bar is remarkable and the true highlight of the hotel. We went up on a weekday afternoon and there were only a couple other tables occupied so we more or less had it to ourselves. Unbeatable views of the coast. The one drawback of the rooftop bar, as other reviews have noted, is that if your room is near the elevator or stairway that gives access to it, it will be noisy during peak bar times (weekend nights). Overall a great value given the location and the modern design update they've given the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: oystergirl2
Reviews.Content: Staying for three nights on a business trip. Read reviews on several sites and selected the Erwin, based on location, rooms and appeal of rooftop bar. Called ahead 3 days prior to ensure we got adjoining rooms - which didn't happen. Rooms are ok. A few nice touches, but feels like a rather cheap fix up of an older hotel. Shower tub looks original (pull back the shower curtain to reveal a mustard green tub that looks like it's from the 80s. Cafe Hash had decent enough food and service but tucked into the side of the entrance of the hotel - so not a great space for anything other than a functional breakfast or meal by yourself if you're traveling for business. The rooftop bar was closed the nights we were there and so there was nowhere to drink in the hotel after the cafe closed. The biggest issue I have is the look of the hotel, relative to the photos on their site. The lounging areas shown are from a very small reception, and an outdoor lounge area right on the curb of a busy street - not a place you'd want to sit and have a drink unless you didn't mind the noise and fumes from the traffic. And the rooftop bar is just a collection of furniture with a temporary bar setup on the roof without protection from the wind - not at all appealing on anything but a sunny day. Also not a lot within walking distance - other than the beach (just one half decent coffee shop and James Beach restaurant) - but it's close to Abbot-Kinney which has a load of great shopping/food. Also had to pay for print outs at the "business center" - two laptops tucked next to the service entrance - first time I've ever had to do that at a hotel. On the plus side great selection of in room minibar treats and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: gberg45
Reviews.Content: An absolutely wonderful place to stay. The staff is outstanding and the hotel is terrific. We had a room with a great view and plenty of room...like a one bedroom apartment. We love the action of the beach and its just a block away. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Hotel Erwin was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JenJones26
Reviews.Content: I came to Hotel Erwin to enjoy the beach and rooftop bar. The view from the rooftop was amazing and I enjoyed every minute of my stay. I will definetly return on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential SoCal Experience”
Reviews.Author: caity1031
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Erwin for a weekend getaway with a girlfriend last May. We just wanted a good old Venice, beachy, fun girls' weekend out. The room started us off right - so 60's Venice! Bright colors, skateboards, butterfly chirs and a grand ocean/boardwalk view (always entertaining). We had cocktail on the Roof (High) both evenings at sunset, which was beyond compare. The staff (Erin) was SUPER helpful offering suggestions of where to have fun on Saturday - drove up the coast to Malibu after a great breakfast at Hash! Can't wait to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: dagbo
Reviews.Content: Great, modern, clean hotel. Great views of Venice Beach. There is a roof top bar which can be a bit noisy if you are staying on the sixth floor (you can hear the music in your room) but as I was jetlagged this wasn't a problem, and am pretty sure it ends before 11 or midnight. Apart from that great staff, good rooms. Wld recommend.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: blue0803
Reviews.Content: Went last night to the Erwin for the Venice Art Crawl. Great vibe. DJ out front with art installations, suites opened throughout the hotel hosting artists, DJ on the roof with spectacular view of the entire Santa Monica bay. If you haven't been here before, you should definitely check this spot out. One of the best places to hang out in Venice and the only place my friends and family from out of town stay. The staff is amazing and very customer service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonathancha
Reviews.Content: I had the distinct pleasure of staying at the Hotel Erwin over Christmas vacation. The service was wonderful. Each member of the staff was friendly and attentive. The beds were comfy, and the view of the beach is ever so inviting. For a more panoramic view of Venice, you can go to the roof top bar and enjoy the sea air. The food at Hash, the restaurant just off of the lobby, was fabulous for breakfast. I suggest the corned beef and hash. It is not from a can, it is in the spirit of the recipe, using actual corned beef and potatoes. I also had a chai latte, which was huge and very refreshing. Will, who works at Hash, sat us and gave us excellent service. He also brought us breakfast via room service the next day, and I have to tell you, his service was just as incredible. If you ever find yourself in Venice and need a place to stay, check it out!

Reviews.Title: “a new hotel gettting quickly very old...”
Reviews.Author: holiworld
Reviews.Content: positives aspects found in the hotel: - kindness of the staff; - roof of the hotel; - position: very closed to the beach now the bad sides we have experienced: - the rooms have a lot of problems: they are getting very old, dirty and demaged. The first night we were in room 330: the door of the bathroom compleately broken, they try to send "the engineer" and he also said that it was better to change room; no safety box (in a 4 stars hotel as it was mentioned by the web-site), very bad smell (humidity maybe??) and the all fornutures seemed to be quiet old...more over the room is exactely facing the street bringing some problems to our "sweet dreams" The second night the staff moved us in room 317: better from the previews one but also in this case the door of the bathroom is very unstable; bad smell ( still umidity) and the heating system was not working at all (it was begging of January with 50Â° F). They told us to be patient because an "engineer" would have come to check but unfortunatelly we didn't see anybody. We tryed again before going to dinner and when we came back nothing was change and nobody told us anything. I think that for that price better to stay somewhere else and to go to Erwin just to drink something on the roof top.

Reviews.Title: “the best dressing gowns in the business”
Reviews.Author: scotsdrifter
Reviews.Content: hotel was great, very unusual dÃ©cor, absolutely spotless, great staff. only hotel i know that gives you green leopardskin print robes. there are a couple of downsides. the couple who had the room next to us smoked on their balcony, they were then charged for a full room and carpet clean, so be careful. our room was on the top floor right underneath the rooftop bar, not a good idea if you are up early for the tours and need to sleep. our room had a side view of muscle beach and the ocean, unfortunately also the back alleys where the local homeless used any corner available as bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: Morningsideralph1
Reviews.Content: Although my wife and I checked in at 2AM, the room was well situated on the 6th floor, northside, with a great view of the Pacific, Venice, and all along the hills to the HOLLYWOOD sign. Having a a walk out terrace with the room was a perk. Breakfast the next morning at HASH, the inhouse restaurant was superb, and the staff seemed pleasant and geared to customer comfort. We would come back and stay again, if circumstances permitted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: IanB1892
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing I can say is that we only stayed for one night en route to Vegas. From check in until check out everything was perfect. I have stayed before when it was a Best Western and they have made massice improvements. Loved it and will return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...won't be returning!”
Reviews.Author: marojaan
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel ws the friendly staff. The worst thing about the hotel were the bathroom doors. They had sliding doors which don't shut all the way so others in the room can easily see into the toilet/shower area of the bathroom. So if you like your privacy...stay away from this hotel. The t.v in my room would turn on by itself at 6:30AM every morning...we mentioned this to the front desk and the "engineer" said he would take a look at it but it was never resolved. Woke us up every morning and no one could explain why. My mom and sisters stayed at the suite and complained about the uncomfortable sofa bed because they could feel the springs. We stayed there for 5 nights and every single day we dreaded going back to our hotel. Like I said, the staff was nice but I would NEVER return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Totally cool in eclectic Venice”
Reviews.Author: blaze4fun
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel that just offers you a room and professional service. This is a hotel that also provides a cool atmosphere and personal service that makes you say "perfect!" Venice Beach has a unique culture of the colorful and bizarre. I want my hotel to have the color, but not the bizarre. The Erwin scored with a modern look and tasteful decor, and in the center of Venice beach, just steps from the sand. The top (6th) floor is a new addition and the rooms have a full window and a little balcony with great views (the Santa Monica side probably has the better view.) Upgrade to the top floor - it is probably well worth it. The rooftop has a bar and is great for sunset watching. Parking isn't cheap (as usual) but I was able to find street parking nearby (just watch the street sweeping times.) I would recommend this hotel just for the location and cool energy. Beyond that, however, the service is the absolute kicker that made me say "oh, yea, this is it." When I signed up for their loyalty program the front desk woman said "you have a birthday coming in a few days, let me send something special to your room". A special treat followed, which totally impressed me. That and many other personal service touches convinced me to write a glowing review. This hotel is cool! As a friend would say, "you gotta stay at the Erwin."

Reviews.Title: “Sunset again....Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Trvlbuggin
Reviews.Content: So I had a going away party here for my girlfriend and she LOVED this place. The rooftop bar is without compare in Venice or in Santa Monica. We had a great oceanfront room and woke up to the relative calm of Venice Beach before the tourists and shopkeepers showed up. Venice isn't for everyone but it makes for a fun staycation and the Hotel Erwin delivers. We had a great breakfast at Hash too! Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure you are getting the room you reserved--not a downgrade.”
Reviews.Author: jdcCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at Joie de Vivre hotels often, but this is our first time here, It has a good beach location, but the front desk crew may have some kind of plan to divert you to a lower priced room. We had reserved a premium king ocean view many months ago, but upon our arrival we were placed in a room that was obviously not a king room and not at all as shown on their internet site. I was too tired to delve into this that night, but early the next morning, I called the front desk and after an involved conversation found out that indeed we were not in a king room. We would have our reserved room by 10 am--but still by 4 pm there was no room available, At this point I told them to forget it and that I would deal with it when I got home--suddenly there was a room available! WHy we were not in this room to begin with I have no idea as these rooms were not full, Is it some money making scheme on the part of management? Plus we were right under their rooftop bar and a loud loud bass pulsed through the room from 11:30 am until 10 at night. I would try their Huntington hotel if you want to stay at the beach as their staff is much better. I saw many foreign tourists staying here and I wondered if they were getting the rooms they had paid for ....

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great experience”
Reviews.Author: jpat24
Reviews.Content: Awesome Place! Stayed here with a group of friends for a birthday. All of my friends thought the hotel was great and that the staff was so welcoming and helpful (which was nice b/c it was my idea to stay at the hotel). The rooftop bar 'high lounge' was really nice to watch the sunset and was a fun way to start night. Heat lamps are spread out over the roof and the staff hands out blankets in the evening, so it wasn't even cold at night in November. Great location, next to the beach/boardwalk and lots of bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hip without the pretentiousness”
Reviews.Author: curiositykilldme
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Dogtown Suite for a birthday celebration. The room is epic! It captures the essence of the location. The white walls, immense space, and high wooden roof is exactly what you'd like to expect from a beachfront abode. However this place has a great kick of style with its clearly skateboard culture inspired decorations and it's own DJ booth! If you're looking for a beach getaway or looking to live like a rock star, this room will accommodate both ranges of taste and need. The hotel itself is in a great location. Everything, and I mean everything, is within walking distance. And if you're looking for a great bar and a great place to watch the sunset, definitely just go to the rooftop bar and you're set. It's a cozy place to socialize and have fun. So cozy, they'll even provide you with blankets! I highly recommend staying here with friends or a fun romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: xshortie23x
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Dog Town Suite and it was amazing!!! Amazing view and great service!! High Bar was awesome. The service was great and they even had blankets for you if you got too cold! I an recommending this place to everyone I know! Can't beat the location of this hotel... Just steps from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Style and comfort at Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: AshEagle
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish, modern hotel just a block from the beach. Venice is "quirky," probably not for everyone. It may have the filthiest sidewalks in the US and perhaps the largest or at least most visible homeless population. But the hotel is very classy with a good small restaurant and rooftop bar with a great view. A seven-story building is a tower in Venice, and you can see all of LA from the roof. We liked our room with an ocean view. The location is very central. It's maybe a 40 minute walk on the boardwalk to the Santa Monica Pier. An express bus from Union Station stops a block away, and it was an easy bus ride to the Getty Center. Don't be misled: L:A has good public transit. We liked the hotel and found Venice really interesting. There is a good restaurant on the boardwalk about ten minutes north: The Fig Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: pch80
Reviews.Content: Really cool hotel. on the boardwalk in Venice. You need to understand that the Venice Boardwalk is eclectic. If that's going to bother you, don't stay on the boardwalk. As someone who used to live in Venice, I loved it. The hotel has a great mod vibe. The Suites are fantastic and even partial ocean view rooms are great. I had my 18 month old with us and he had a great time. They are family friendly but they are not going to cater to your baby ( and really should not have to) so if that's what you want choose elsewhere. Hash, the restaurant on site, was super yummy and not expensive with lots of great choices. High, the lounge they have upstairs is AMAZING! great views, great food, great mood, great service. JUST AMAZING. Hotel Erwin is one of the only hotels I have ever stayed in that does not try to gauge you on prices. What you get for the price is exactly right and the mini bar options are so reasonable ( at least for us) that we had no trouble taking them up on it and enjoying our mini bar. It was just nice to see that fairness in price. The service especially Miguel and Eugene was wonderful. They really make you feel that you are an invited guest and will go out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible Another plus for the hotel that they hired such service oriented people. ok, so that's alot of good. Here's the bad. And for me, it's the only bad that counts really. The hotel was dirty. Really dirty. Our first room, partial ocean view, was filthy. Someone else's dirty used contacts on table, broken glass on floor that my husband stepped on, absolutely disgusting closet with food particles and dust inches thick, stains on walls, the cushions on the deck were filthy, cigarette burned bird poop on chairs.. dirty. I complained and they upgraded us and apologized and the suite, in all fairness was clean and lovely. But even the hallways had dirty glasses and stuff lying about the hall way. Just my experience. Alot of good but admittedly the bad is pretty bad, for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: Legally_blonde11
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great position on Venice, rooms are large and spacious, shower is excellent, beds are super comfortable and they have a nice feel to them generally. The staff are friendly and wonderful and nothing is too much trouble. Miguel, Eugene and Rich (the night mananger) are all very much integral to the experience, as they go out of their way to make your stay more enjoyable. Indeed, I have had to deal with the General Manager Benjamin on another matter and he also is lovely and courteous. YOu are made to feel truly welcome. In my view, this is a vastly different experience to other hotels in the area. High, the rooftop bar at the Erwin (with tapas style food) is AWESOME, great view, fantastic Argentinian beef tacos (a must) and great ambience. I made the mistake of staying at the Bayside Hotel (what turned out to be a $150 a night fleabag motel) on a recent 3 day trip to LA, and in desperation called the Erwin and they squeezed me in at late notice and even called a cab to come and pick me up from the Bayside. Hotel Erwin - all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel in Weirdtown”
Reviews.Author: DanishAccent
Reviews.Content: A nice trendy hotel on the famous boardwalk where you're surrounded by weirdos, hippies, reggae lovers, and the best riff-raff Southern Cal can offer. And all this is meant as a compliment! At Erwin, I would recommend getting a room on the 4th or 5th floor. And if you can afford it, one with partial or full sea view, so it's not too dark. A lot of the rooms are facing a not too exciting alley. The service was good. The people who worked there were great and upbeat, but they seemed a little understaffed in the reception.But do stay here when you want to visit Venice Beach. It'll take you back to the Seventies - if you ever have been there!

Reviews.Title: “Hits the mark for an out of the box travel experience at ecentric Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: SusanDallasTexas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erwin hits the mark for a comfortable, design-centric, hip stay in a ground zero location on Venice beach. The service was excellent, from the reservation process (we booked direct with Jaire) to check in, to drinks at Hash, to small requests for extra towels, shampoo, etc. The hotel was the perfect fit for our party which included self, husband and 21 year old son. Beds and linens were very comfortable, flat screen TV's top notch and our suite was roomy and eclectically appointed. Would highly recommend this hotel for a good value, out-of-the-box experience that perfectly suits its environs.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been great, if they hadn't messed up our charges.”
Reviews.Author: hiljayc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer on a whim, and loved it. We decided to bring our friends here this time, and booked on tablethotels.com, as the resort I work at uses tablet, and it is a great website. We stayed in a suite with a pull out and a fireplace, it was roomy and the decor was to our liking. The package that I booked came with a $50 credit at the restaurant. Upon check in I asked what the deal was on that, and the gentleman who helped me was unsure, and there was no record of this on our reservation, but after asking his colleague they came to the conclusion that we would eat there, and then the $50 would be taken off of our bill at check in, and there was no reason to let the restaurant know. When it came time to check out the person that was checking us out said that we should have let the restaurant know when eating about this, although we had been told differently at check in. I explained to him the situation, and then checked out. The bill that he gave me was $100 over what we had agreed to pay on tablethotels.com. When I asked the gentleman why this was, he said I would need to provide proof of our rate. I used their computer to print off the receipt from tablethotels.com which clearly had the rate at $100 less what they were charging. After about 10 minutes of debate, and me having to get a little upset, they realized that they were in the wrong, and fixed the problem. As I have worked with tablethotels.com personally before, I don't understand why they didn't have the correct rate or any information about the voucher in their records. It was frustrating at the time, but overall they corrected their wrongs, and because of the location and the rooms decor, I would definitely stay here again. I just hope that next time there is no issue with the billing.

Reviews.Title: “Worst family trip”
Reviews.Author: audioengine
Reviews.Content: this review is for a deluxe king bed room only. other rooms may vary. valet parking only. for $28/night. you can't access your stuff in the vehicle once it's parked. cheaply built. un-tasteful art. but drug addicts or underground punk band members might like it. un-family friendly. not satisfied at all aside from the fact that you can walk to the beach. the deluxe room doesnt have a microwave. i have a baby that feeds thrice at night. theyre asking for $60 for rm upgrade w/ microwave. cant provide a microwave for a single night. no refrigerator. they only have the chiller. a very small one at that. i want to stock some ice cream in the ref for the children cause it's hot. but not possible in this deluxe room. there's no sense of elegance inside and out at all.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Venice Location, Rooftop can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Elyse1316
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Erwin for one Saturday night in August to celebrate with a group friends. We booked a large suite complete with partial kitchen, fireplace, kitchen table and sitting area separate from the small bedroom. The appointments and decor were great along with a nice touch of street art posters and murals throughout the room. The best touch was the Sam Flores bathroom door. The room was great, however, there were many touches throughout that needed a little rehab. I'm a chipped paint snob, so it is a bit of a turn off when you pay several hundred dollars and walk into a room that needs some repairs. i don't know why those details are so commonly overlooked by upscale hotels. The best part of the hotel is the 7th floor rooftop deck. Grab a corner couch at sunset and enjoy the boardwalk scene with a delicious cocktail. The food was not very good, so sip your drinks slowly and save your appetite for the restaurants on Abbott Kinney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, hip room, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: vkbrennan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with our two boys - 7 and 9. They loved the lollipops at the front desk, the cool one bedroom suite that we were upgraded to, the food at Hash, the view of the Hollywood sign at High, the cool location right by Venice Beach. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Runninguy1011
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor recommendations as I was looking for something different to the standard chain hotels. The location is good (very close to the beach and a long-ish walk to Santa Monica). The hotel had an interesting retro vibe, and the roof deck is cool. The staff were friendly and helpful. My only gripe was that the 'free wi fi' is only 'free' if you join their club; which is in turn free but a pain nonetheless. Overall we had a nice stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Wonderful views from the roof”
Reviews.Author: Friday13th_9
Reviews.Content: THe Hotel Erwin is a fantastic boutique hotel! Less than a block from Venice beach it makes it an interesting place just due to the location. The hotel is in fantastic shape at least the 5th and 6th floors where my wife and I stayed and some friends stayed. They have a rooftop bar that is so cool with great heat lamps and quality servers. There is also a small cafe that serves very interesting dishes, simple but very nice. The burgers and the Mac and Cheese are my top choices. The staff also has some great food choices in walking distance. I am looking forward to coming back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Santa Monica - not Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: Elvis45rpm
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel when it was a Best Western. I have to say I preferred it then. Its now very chic and very expensive. They have taken away the inclusive breakfast, shuttle to Santa Monica and the valet parking is compulsory. It's very pretentious (stupid coffee makers) though the art on the wall remains as good as it always was. It was the only room on our 9 hotel vacation where the wi-fi was restricted to members. The room is full of things to buy and one gets the feeling that it's pay-pay-pay. The new roof terrace is great but very overpriced drinks have a compulsory 18% service charge added. We paid extra for a sea view room but it was very noisy due to the music on the roof. It can't say its a bad hotel. It isn't. But it belongs in Santa Monica - not the more relaxed Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Odor”
Reviews.Author: zaney4jaz
Reviews.Content: After checking-in and entering our room - there was an overpowering odor of "an illegal substance," even though this was supposed to be a non-smoking hotel! Immediately called down to the front desk and was moved to another room. Too bad that this was the first impression we received.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: winekitty
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Hotel Erwin for one night. I took part in their "Ink N Wink" package! The tat came out better than I could have ever imagined. I got a a pretty large one I might add so it took longer than expected. Hotel was very understanding and allowed us to have extended chack out. The front desk concierge-Migel I believe his name was had a very welcoming smile and was very attentive to all requests. The room was great.We had a one bedroom suite. The balcony over looking the boardwalk was amazing. My only gripe was the bathroom, very small although nicly tiled. Fireplace was very easy to operate. They also have a great goody box in the kitchette that had interesting products you don't see in many places. I work in the hotel busniess and have never given a property five stars-but Erwin has one me over! The customer service was the best that I have seen in many years of traveling.Thank you Erwin for a truly memorable stay-I'm not just saying that because I got inked!-)

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip in a great leisurely setting.”
Reviews.Author: Carver-iD
Reviews.Content: Went to LA for business and stayed at the Hotel Erwin in Venice Beach for a change of pace from the hotels near the airport. Turned out to be a great move. The hotel was right near the beach so I was able to go for a run in a scenic setting as opposed to a fitness room on a treadmill. Internet service was satisfactory so I could get work done in my room which faced the ocean. Once work was done I would go to the rooftop bar for a beer to relax. You can't ask for a better "business" trip than that.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations perfect service better!”
Reviews.Author: ddigeronimo915
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego and work throughout the state along with other states in the nation. Have been working and traveling for 8 years of my life and stayed in some nice spots. Hotel Erwin however was one of the nicest and cleanest places I have been in a long time. The room was clean and retrofitted with all the right amenities. The staff was super signed me up for Joy Luck club at the front desk and provide us with super service on the rooftop lounge. The location is ideal in the heart of Veince Beach, CA. A rooftop lounge that overlooks the beach and ocean! As I said I live in CA and I felt as if I were on vacation up there. Perfect spot to bring clients/customers in LA to relax and enjoy the weather above all the crazies below. If you have people from out of state this is the place to take them!!! Food, Drinks and best spot in town to people watch not to mention night life around the hotel all with in walking distance. Breakfast at Hash was super! All in all a perfect stop on my business travels and one that I will come back too. I am now planning my travels around JDV Hotels locations throughout the State!

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Haven with a smile”
Reviews.Author: ChristyBK
Reviews.Content: After 10 days traveling CA's Hwy 1 from San Fran to LA on a roadtrip with my boyfriend, Erwin was the perfect finish to an amazing trip before heading back to home sweet Brooklyn. There are a lot of minimalist, stylish urban hotels that try to hard to make their customers feel "privileged" to stay in these "cooler than thou" environments. When we are paying the rather hefty price to be right on Venice Beach, that attitude is such a turn off. However, I never got that vibe from Hotel Erwin. The staff was amazingly friendly, courteous, and respectful. The valet staff was professional and timely and although we cringed at the price for the nightly valet fee, it was quickly eased by the friendliness and courteous attitude of the employees. Awesome and efficient. The front desk was accommodating and polite and went out of their way to give recommendations, assist with questions about the area, and even comp a bottle of wine or two for joining the Joie de Vie club (free) which provided us free internet during our stay (essential for technojunkies such as ourselves). The rooftop bar was a nice perk- beautiful views and chill music especially late afternoon (we avoided the scene at night- a bit too annoying). The guest rooms were beautifully designed with great manga-esque drawings on the closet door- complimenting the original photography and urban graffiti viewed throughout the hotel. Bathroom was small but functional and we liked the vanity/ bar area that separated the living area by modern yellow aluminum mesh screen that displayed large sunglasses for sale (if you so desired to purchase). Good stuff all around and definitely loved the partial ocean view that allowed us to wake up to the foggy morning sunlight that soon revealed the eclectic sounds and characters we so love on the Venice Beach boardwalk. Lastly- I don't know how they do it but our 5th floor room was really quiet despite the dj spinning tunes on the rooftop and drunken revellers on the streets below. As soon as our balcony door shut, we happily drifted off looking forward to another morning waking up at Erwin. The on-site restaurant Hash was closed for repairs during our visit but there are so many amazing restaurants right around the corner that I left feeling full in every way. Highly recommend this place...it's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem of a location in Venice Beach - amazing view from rooftop deck!”
Reviews.Author: nhfn
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Erwin, and the staff really made it more enjoyable. The front desk staff was very welcoming, and very resourceful when it came to suggesting local places to visit or eat. The rooms are nicely designed and very clean - we enjoyed our room on the 6th floor facing north which gave us a great view from the balcony of the Venice Beach Boardwalk right below us. Their restaurant, Hash, had amazing food - a destination even for those not staying at the hotel. And the rooftop lounge/deck High is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service! & gorgeous hotel (:”
Reviews.Author: Lorengoodwin
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after being at a dump, so we needed friendly people, & great service & this is exactly what we had! We called for a reservation the night before Fourth of July & we didn't think that there would be an opening, but there was & we got there & i absolutely fell in love with this hotel. I'm fifteen years old & it's just a very hip & retro hotel. i absolutely love it! Rick helped us, he was so friendly & great! then we got up to the rooms & the room we stayed it was awesome, everything they had was just great, very comfy, & cool. The outside deck was great. Everything was very colorful & chic. It's not even two minutes from Venice Beach, which is very nice! When we woke up the next morning we went to the Hash cafe, & it was very yummy, great service & food. I recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Venice Beach area! FANTASTIC EVERYTHING :D

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: CarolC1962
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 4 night stay. This hotel is funky and fits the Venice Beach atmoshere. Rooms were clean and loved the roof top lounge the view was great. Cannot say enough about the staff from Eugene at the front desk to the Hash staff that brought our breakfast. Location was perfect. I would stay again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “nicely done remodel”
Reviews.Author: patmon
Reviews.Content: We missed the new rooms/bar/restaurant when we stayed last year. Definite upgrade. Can't beat the rooftop bar at sunset. Also had a very nice breakfast on the patio in the morning. Will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: BenWissinger
Reviews.Content: The room was so much fun and the views were excellent. The staff made the stay so enjoyable. In addition, the location was fantastic with memorable, especially from the roof-top bar!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome-”
Reviews.Author: h20babyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Erwin for a weekend getaway and it was a much needed break. I loved the fact that we could watch the free entertainment on Venice Beach, but when we neeed to escape the madness, Hotel Erwin was right there. You can't beat the location and our view of the ocean was amazing. The beds were super comfortable too! I highly suggest the rooftop lounge because they have an amazing view of the Venice Beach, and the drinks were great. Pricy, but well worth it. The staff were friendly and accomodating. I would definitely come back to this place..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Venice Beach”
Reviews.Author: niehub
Reviews.Content: We had the most enjoyable stay at then end of our Road Trip in Hotel Erwin. We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and discovered LA from there. At check in en during the whole we were provided with perfect service from Front Desk staff, who were always happy to answer any questions and give advice about what to visit in LA. The city tour booked by the front desk was very good. The beds in the rooms are really comfortable, big and soft. We also had a room at the alley, but did not have any noise from the bar next door. Very complete and original Mini bar items. It would be nice to have some smaller bottles of liquor in the mini bar. The only thing we missed in the room is a shaving mirror. We loved the complimentary Wolfgang Puck coffee in the room!!!! It is very recommendable to have breakfast and at least one dinner at Hash. The menu is not very big, but you will always find something of your choice. All dishes have a very original touch from the Chef. Prices are very friendly! Last night we were surprised by a fire alarm at 00:30 hours. We all had to leave the room because some joker activated the alarm. This all was handled very professionally by the staff members. If we return to LA, there is no doubt about where to stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Could be great, but isn't”
Reviews.Author: KavehK
Reviews.Content: If you value location and interior design then this is the perfect place to be if you plan to visit Venice Beach. The location is truly awesome and the rooms are nicely designed. The design and the feeling has the right Venice vibe mixed with some modern touches The staff is really friendly and will help you as much as they can.. But that's it. The hotel claims it has free Wi-FI (according to hotels.com), but it hasn't. We were a group of people who needed internet to do some work so we had to pay additional 6$ per night per person for it for standard speed and 10$ for high-speed. That's just bad. Half of the channels on the TV didn't work, including HBO. The bathrooms didn't have real doors, just sliding ones that left a couple of inches of free sight at the sides. Needless to say it makes you uncomfortable going to the bathroom knowing everyone in the room can look at you doing your thing. 28$ for valet parking is too much. The whole building and the rooms had a bit of a weird smell. The housekeeping was awful. We were four people in one of the rooms and we NEVER got four towels or four sets of anything. One time we didn't even get any towels at all. We had to ask for towels every day until we got tired of it the last day and just made it with two towels. Other than that the beds weren't made so well and housekeeping they came at weird hours, sometimes at 10 am, sometimes at 4 pm.. The water pressure was lousy, it made it pretty unpleasant having a shower. Generally it's an average hotel that could've been really great if the management really did pay attention to small details. Being nice, friendly and having a great level of service doesn't do much when there isn't a door to the toilet or you never have enough towels. But I still recommend it to others considering the perfect location and the fact that errors were corrected when told about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, don't valet park, check your bill.”
Reviews.Author: ramblinman
Reviews.Content: Hash is a great breakfast spot, one day they were fast, the next day slow, but always friendly, and the food was good. The rooftop at night is pretty cool, worth checking out. Valet parking is $38/night, right across the street (not Pacific, the side street) you can park for $20/night, no brainer. Pull in drop your bags, drive another 10 yards, or just park and carry, it's very close. Venice Beach is the usual Bohemia, it's has it's "cool", but the number of Mad Max looking street urchins has increased. It's a big issue, and a problem. They leave you alone for the most part, but they stink, and filth the place up. One morning I bought a breakfast sandwich, then realized I'd have to stand to eat because most of the benches are scummed up by street scum. They have a problem and the locals know it. There is an increased police presence. I called 911 one morning because a guy (mid-twenties) was laying on the oceanwalk moaning, in severe pain and distress, everyone was just passing him by....just another drug overdose. Paramedics came to his rescue. The place is the perfect example of what too much freedom of everything can can create. Back to the hotel, check your bill. I was charged $25 for a bottle of Vodka that I didn't take. I suspect it was housekeeping, or they missed it from the last guest. They removed it from my bill. Also I overheard another guest being told that if they showed the room key in Hash they received a discount, no mention of it when I checked in. Of course I mentioned it and received the 25%. It didn't seem like they wanted everyone to know. A great place if you want to be close to the beach, the staff is friendly and very helpful. Heather, Miguel, and the doormen are very professional, and pleasant. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a peaceful couple getaway...”
Reviews.Author: JustinKinsey
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at this hotel, because it was the most expensive, and I thought it would be the best, but you don't always get what you pay for. A partial ocean view upgrade is not worth the dance club next door pumping bass into your room until 3 AM, as well as the view of the garbage-can alley way. The hotel is set 200 yards off the ocean, so any ocean view is partially blocked by the boardwalk, a parking lot, and building or so. If I had the opportunity to give Joie De Vivre another chance, I probably wouldn't unless it was in a different location. Bring ear plugs, and watch for the shower water's changing temperatures, poor air circulation, and thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Quickly responds to mistakes too bad they made them.”
Reviews.Author: passion4people
Reviews.Content: We arrived late to check-in and we loved the rooms. Two tween girls got the pullout and the rest of us the big king bed. I sat on the balcony and had some wine and chocolate after a long drive from San Francisco. The morning we were hungry and ready to hit the beach for the few hours we were there, too bad the room service waitress forgot our order. We got a call to see how breakfast was before we even had received it. She forgot to ask how we wanted the eggs on the hash and so she called and got that info. We wanted longer with still a no show, finally the manger got involved and within about 10 minutes we got our food. He comped it of course since it took over an hour and half for eggs!!! The girls (all of us really) were hungry and wanted to get to the beach! The manger told us to help ourselves to the mini bar food and we did to stop our stomachs from growling as we waited and he comped all that too. We needed something from our Van but they had forgot to tag it when we came in and could not find it so 30 minutes later I went down and got the stuff out myself. We only had one day at Venice Beach and we spent two hours waiting around for them to get things right. The other thing I heard after on was that the room next to ours was very loud so the tweens did not sleep much. Once the manger heard of our day, he comped our whole stay and gave us an extra hour after late check-out so we could get to the beach. Everyone, but the room service person was polite and kind during all of this. So once again when the Manager heard what was happening he stepped up and fixed it. Thank you for being accountable for your staff. I will give them a second try, the location and rooms were worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LUVPALMSPRINGS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Erwin with friends for 2 nights. It was a truly amazing experience. We stayed on the 6th floor witch is a brand new addtion to the hotel. Every room has a panoramc view that spans from Downtown LA to the ocean. The room was beautiful with a 50's retro vibe. Everything is new and clean. There is a roof top area with sofas, cocktails, snacks and on unobstructed view forever. Two thumbs up. Way up!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy rates for a substandard hotel”
Reviews.Author: cteague1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 unplanned nights after our plane could not leave LA for London due to the volcano. While I in no way expected the Erwin to match the previous fortnight spent in Tahiti, I was pretty disappointed on a number of levels and would not recommend this establishment. The rate went from 150 to 200 to 270 USD per night over the 6 days because I was told the occupancy rate went up. Every time I had to rebook to stay a few more nights I was made to feel like they were doing me a favour by letting me stay there. I know hotels are a business, but they clearly exploited the accommodation shortage. Corridors were noisy at night as the revellers from the rooftop bars returned to their rooms. There were two power cuts during our stay so pity the people on the sixth floor having to use the stairs and walk through pitch black hallways. There did not appear to be any back up safety lights at all. The weekend cleaners pinched a packet of cigarettes from an unopened carton I had bought for a relative. Neither of us smoke so we know this was deliberate. I did not report it to the desk as it is hardly grand larceny, but does not make for a comfortable stay. If I had wanted to store any real valuables, forget it, because the safe door was broken and this, they could not fix. I hid our passports under the carpet behind the bed and noticed an uncovered electrical socket on the wall. This is a safety hazard. The night we did eat at the tiny restaurant, we found it quite mediocre and overpriced, unatmospheric and cold. The rooftop bar is OK, but they add 20% tips to the drinks before you have even taken a sip. The patrons are not the glitterati of LA, but then Venice Beach is a dump so fair enough. The one good thing that happened was that we were initially given a room that we found to be occupied when we carried our cases up to the second floor. The occupant was in the shower! The young receptionist did apologise and gave us a 15 dollar voucher for breakfast. Apology accepted and gesture appreciated. What was completely unacceptable however was when I went to pay for the first night and a different receptionist was very forthright in asking me to donate money to charities that help the many needy people in the locality. My firm 'no' met with a decidedly dirty look. This is appalling as I was a stranded traveller having to pay out for an unexpected hotel stay and I pay UK taxes and I am not responsible for the economic policies of the US which mean there are loads of vagrants on the streets. This just left a sour taste. The location of Venice beach means that you will be harangued by people asking you for money as soon as you step out of the door. Wearing a new pair of sneakers and having clean clothes is enough to make you a magnet for these people. Some of them are quite nice, but if you are not in the mood or not the type of person to humour them, do not stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Beachside at the Erwin”
Reviews.Author: world_in_my_eyes
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Hotwire & was quite pleased overall. Upon check-in, we upgraded our room to a queen size with partial ocean view. We were on the south side of the 6th floor and our room had a balcony with nice ocean views. We were on the highest occupied floor, and one floor below the roof top bar. The proximity to Venice Beach & the beach walk was excellent, although beware, Venice Beach gets a bit sketchy once the sun goes down. I don't think I would go walking around in the dark near there. We did not eat at the restaurant or try the roof bar as we were in town for a wedding & had many pre-planned events to attend. The building was very sturdy & quiet thanks to the solid concrete construction. They just don't make buildings like this anymore. The room decor was good, bed was comfortable, with good quality linens & towels/toiletries. It had a 42" plasma TV but we had not much time to watch it. Fully stocked mini-bar. Great 'pod' coffee maker. My biggest complaint about the room was the terribly low water pressure. No idea if it was isolated to our room or hotel wide, but way too weak for my taste. The valets were fast & friendly, which I would expect for the $28/night parking charge. Only one elevator serving the guest rooms meant wait times could be long, and could get really ugly if the hotel was full, which it was not. Now for what bothered me. The morning we were leaving, Sunday, 4-18-2010, there were several power outages. The first few lasted less than one minute, and I didn't think much about it. We go to the elevator on our way to check out & see that it is out of service. A staff member advised us to take the service elevator. Just as we were about to get in, the power went out again but this time it did not come back on. So we headed to the stairwell & began to walk down. Much to my surprise there was no emergency lighting in the stairwell & it was pitch black. I don't know what the building codes are in California, but where I live in Chicago they have such strict codes for hotels & office buildings concerning emergency lighting in stairwells, I was really shocked by the lack. When we got to the lobby, we learned the situation was due to the city doing work nearby. I totally know the outage was not the hotel's fault, but my advice would be to figure out an emergency lighting option asap for the stairwells. It was extremely unnerving to have to walk down 6 floors in total darkness & not to mention a huge liability. The staff didn't seem to have any flash lights either. And it was a good thing we didn't take the service elevator as someone was stuck in it when the power failed. Yikes! Talk about timing is everything...One minute earlier & I would have been in there. I was on my way to the wedding that morning. I think the bride would not have been too happy if her maid of honor was trapped in an elevator!! Power outage & scary stairwells notwithstanding, I really did enjoy my stay at the Erwin.

Reviews.Title: “bipolar hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonHouston
Reviews.Content: We had two totally different experiences during one stay at the Erwin. Our first room needed to be updated...The sliding door did not completely close off the toilet, shower area - leaving a desire for privacy. The TV remote didn't work. The room was very small. Then, I told the desk about the remote and suddenly they offered a suite to us for our last night because the TV was broken and so the remote could not be fixed. The suite was lile a different hotel. Modern, updated, complete bathroom with a regular door on it.....So, obviously your experience will depend on the room that you get...The first room had an old TV set and the suite had a flat screen TV. That sort of sums it up...The roof bar was absolutely stupendous...Couldn't have been more a more beautiful view...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LightningMcQueen79
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The service was excellent. The bed was really comfortable and I didn't hear too much from other patrons. The food and service at the restaurant was awesome. After 1 meal there I decided to have all my breakfasts and dinners there.

Reviews.Title: “Never fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: JackzSpratz
Reviews.Content: Married in 2005 on the Podium on Venice Beach we return each year for our anniversery and attend the Muscle Beach tournament on Labor Day. This year will be our 6th time. We discovered the Marina Pacific (as it was then) and never looked back. The Erwin has been re-furbished and last year for our first visit we were not dissapointed. The staff excel and nothing is ever too much trouble. Food is varied and room service good. Clean and very comfortable, we are particularly fond of a long serving cleaner on the 4th floor.
